input_text:
Email 1:
Hello Mr. Porter,                    Could you help us with 2,200MT of wheat from Tangier to Guangzhou? We are keen to know if there are any congestions, and when you would like to clear your storage.                    Best Regards,                    Larry
Email 2:
Mr. Porter,
                                Sorry for not contacting you earlier, but we were travelling.                      We hope the weather didn't impact you and your family too much. We appreciate you accepting our order, and we hope our dealings go smoothly.                      Could you help us to prepare your company's shipping documents. We would be happy to follow your company's terms.                      Best Regards,                      [Name removed] [CEO]
Email 3:
Hello Mr. Porter,
Thanks for the cargo status update. We really appreciate your speedy assistance. I just wanted to give you an update on our side: 
We are expecting to receive the shipment by Saturday, March 19. 
We also want to give you a special request for the unloading. We would like to unblock your warehouse and then use a forklift to pick up the cargo. After that, you can close the warehouse for the spring. I believe the steamroller is operating right now. We will gladly pay for any extra costs. 
With great appreciation, 
Mr. Zhang
[VP Sales]


<Email 4>:
Hi Mr. Porter,
We are pleased to receive the update from [Department removed] about the Bill of Lading number. We will forward the request to our procurement department and they will get back to you as soon as possible.
Email 4:
Hi Mr. Porter,
We are pleased to receive the update from [Department removed] about the Bill of Lading number. We will forward the request to our procurement department and they will get back to you as soon as possible.

<Email 4>:
 Good morning,
I just finished my B2B conference call, and we are happy to be able to discuss the possible shipment of [URL removed] tanks. The sale would be for 3000 tanks, and we need them to be shipped by August 1st at the latest. The shipment has to be ocean freight and shipped from the port of destination to the port of origination. 

We would be happy to follow your company's terms and conditions for the order. I would be happy to ship a TOT, but if you need more information before then, we can send the relevant document to you.

Thank you very much for your time and we hope to work with your company in the near future!

Sincerely,

Kobe


Hey Ken
We will probably know more tomorrow. If I hear back by the end of the week, I will let you know.
Thanks a lot
Email 5:
Hey Ken
I hope everything is well with you. We heard back from the contact at Tangier on the situation. We were told that there are no other problems and that the equipment is available. The lead time would be about 7 days. We were told to confirm the availability of the cargo with [Party removed] and then make payment. 

Let me know if you want to receive the e-mail contact with [Party removed].

Thank you, 
Ram

<Email 5>:
Good evening,
We received your message. The owner is currently not at the office. We will get back to you once he has responded.
Thank you,

input_text:
Email 1:
Matthieu,                    This is my first time doing this. If I can get this right, next time will be easier. And that's when you need to get people around you to write this kind of emails!                    Please help me out.                    Thanks,                    Alice
Email 2:
Hey Matthieu,                 Just sent you an email 1. Don't be in a rush! It's just practice. Remember to email out the month 1 write-ups too!
                    Hello Alice,                 Hi,                    I just received email 1. Here's email 2. I understand that we are only in week 2, but the writing in email 1 isn't as good as it can be. It's a shame because we already wasted a lot of time to form a group, invest in a class room and do a lot of planning. Writing is what makes you sound more professional. You can see why? The current 1st email doesn't speak in a professional manner. I could understand that Alice was in a hurry, but it's understandable to give some "tips" to improve writing in order to save time in the future.                    Keep it up and the
Email 3:
Hi Matthieu,                    I'm a bit overwhelmed here. I tried writing as many emails as possible. This is mainly because you are helping me out. Thanks for this.
                    Could you check email 3 and 4?
Thanks,
Alice
Email 4:
Email 3 <etc> is much better. Here is another email, email 4. It's quite long but I did my best to correct all mistakes.
                    I'm aware that we have already lost some time in the past weeks. I'm really sorry about that. I didn't think that my writing would turn out so bad. I don't know if you want me to do the writing work or not, but I think I'm learning more from it. I like to think of writing like a reflex that can be acquired. There is no use to just sit and wait for Alice to do it right. I really enjoy your emails and really appreciate your feedback. Is it alright if I write the next email and just copy paste everything from my mentor email to save time? That's what I'm planning to do.
                    By the way, if there is something you want me to
output_text:
From: alice.smith@company.com
To: matthieu.dupont@company.com
Subject: First Practice Email - Training Exercise
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 09:30
Body: Dear Matthieu,

This is my first attempt at professional email writing as part of our training exercise. I understand that mastering this skill will make future correspondence easier. I appreciate your guidance in helping me develop proper business communication skills.

Thank you for your support.

Best regards,
Alice

---

From: matthieu.dupont@company.com
To: alice.smith@company.com
Subject: Re: First Practice Email - Training Exercise
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 10:45
Body: Dear Alice,

Thank you for your first practice email. While I understand we're only in week 2 of the training, there's significant room for improvement in the writing style. Given the investment we've made in organizing this training program, including securing a classroom and developing the curriculum, it's important that we focus on professional communication standards.

I'll provide detailed feedback to help you develop a more professional tone in your future correspondence. Remember that effective writing is crucial for professional credibility.

Best regards,
Matthieu

---

From: alice.smith@company.com
To: matthieu.dupont@company.com
Subject: Re: Additional Practice Emails
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 14:20
Body: Dear Matthieu,

I've been working on additional practice emails as part of the exercise. I appreciate your continued guidance and feedback. Could you please review my latest attempts?

Best regards,
Alice

---

From: matthieu.dupont@company.com
To: alice.smith@company.com
Subject: Re: Additional Practice Emails
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 15:30
Body: Dear Alice,

I notice significant improvement in your latest attempts. While I apologize for the delayed start in our previous weeks, I can see you're making good progress. Your dedication to learning is evident, and I agree that writing professional emails becomes more natural with practice.

Regarding your question about using templates from mentor emails - while it's fine to use them as reference points, I encourage you to develop your own writing style within professional parameters.

Let's continue working on your progress.

Best regards,
Matthieu

input_text:
Email 1:
Thank you for your recent inquiries on bitumen shipments.                    I will work on this inquiry and get back to you by next week.                    Regards,                    Rina
Email 2:
Greetings!                            I had the pleasure of meeting you last week and inquiring about         bitumen shipments. I trust you are well and I look forward to your          reply.                    Should you require any additional information about our services, please feel free to contact me.                    Kind regards,                            Rina


I started working on this email in Outlook 2016 and when it was done I went to Outlook Web Access and published it to my email account. I went back to my computer and the email wasn't finished yet. How can I edit the email in OWA?
Thank you

Sorry for the inconvenience.
You can edit this email in OWA.
Click the email you want to edit.
Click More... > Open the item.
This also allows you to check your mail on another device with web browser.
Email 3:
>Dear sir,

>Thank you for your recent inquiries on bitumen shipments. I will work on this inquiry and get back to you by next week.
>I am forwarding your inquiry to Jeroen. Should you require any additional information about our services, please feel free to contact me.
>Regards,
>______
Email 4:
<Hi Sir/Jean,

>Kindly see below for the updated information.

>Thanks,

>Kind regards,
>______

However, email 3 is missing email 4, and email 2 and 4 are missing a signature block.
Is there a way to make it work?

Thanks
Zeca
Thanks for the email.

When you create a new email, you should be able to see the Send button (in Outlook 2016/2013/2010/2007) or the Save button (in Outlook 2003), and have the other options greyed out. If this is not the case, we need to find out why.
It looks like email 4 does not have a send button, only save. This means that you cannot send that email. The email should probably be copied over to a separate email in Outlook and sent from there.

Another thing
Email 5:
>Sir,

>Kindly see below for the updated information.

>Thanks,

>Regards,

>_________
Note the lack of a signature line below.

Unfortunately, in your case, email 3 is missing signature 4, and email 2 and 4 are missing signature 1. It's possible that the sender has deleted these emails before they were sent.
I can confirm that the emails are not being sent, they were deleted from my mailbox. This is a security measure taken when email 3 was created (not a complete email).
Since this is a security measure, there is no way to undo it. However, you can contact me to see if we can send out email 3 using another email address.
If we cannot get email 3, we can look into getting email 1.

Why is my Outlook item missing my signature?

How to attach a file to an email

input_text:
Email 1:
Dear Ms. Castillo,                    Our 1,600MT of FWA are currently enroute to Manzanillo. I need a vessel to take it to Cadiz. Could you please advise me on the earliest possible laycan and the latest arrival port time into Cadiz?                    Thanks,                    Roberto
Email 2:
Dear Roberto,                 I had a quick look at the AIS schedule but unfortunately they don't call at Cadiz. I was also trying to find a connection to Cadiz in the London schedule but it's not in there either. However, I've just found a possibility via Vigo in Spain. Could you please let me know if you'd be open to a Vigo port call? (this is for your risk management). The AIS calls into Cadiz on 21st August which is out of your risk windows but the AIS only sails to Vigo on the 20th. We could ship to Vigo and arrange a lorrie for you to pick it up (1,600MT of FWA I am assuming?). I can do the paperwork and let you know the terms as well.                        Thank you,                         Eileen

1.  **Write the appropriate Email 2**
output_text:
From: roberto.martinez@trading.com
To: eileen.castillo@shipping.com
Subject: Vessel Request: Manzanillo to Cadiz - 1,600MT FWA
Timestamp: 2023-08-01 09:30
Body: Dear Ms. Castillo,

Our 1,600MT of FWA are currently enroute to Manzanillo. I need a vessel to take it to Cadiz. Could you please advise me on the earliest possible laycan and the latest arrival port time into Cadiz?

Thanks,
Roberto

---

From: eileen.castillo@shipping.com
To: roberto.martinez@trading.com
Subject: Re: Vessel Request: Manzanillo to Cadiz - 1,600MT FWA
Timestamp: 2023-08-01 11:45
Body: Dear Roberto,

I had a quick look at the AIS schedule but unfortunately they don't call at Cadiz directly. I've explored alternative routes and found a possibility via Vigo, Spain.

We could arrange the following:
- Ship the cargo to Vigo (vessel arrival on August 20th)
- Arrange truck transportation from Vigo to Cadiz for the 1,600MT FWA

Please let me know if this alternative routing would work for your risk management requirements. If you're interested, I can provide the complete terms and handle the necessary documentation.

Thank you,
Eileen

input_text:
Email 1:
Dear John,                    Do you have any openings for transporting 14,000 gallons of hydrochloric acid from Rotterdam to Hamburg? The preferred mode of transport is Barge.                    If possible, start as early as May 17, and end no later than May 30th.                    Thanks,                    Amanda
Email 2:
John,                        Can you please tell me the cost of shipping 100 tons of biomass from Chicago to Rotterdam by rail?                Thanks,                    Miles


1. Greet the reader (by their name, if you know it) and tell them what the email is about.
2. What is the sender asking about? What do they need?
3. What are the main requirements? (To or from, time, quantity etc.)
4. Who is the sender? What do they do? How can you help them?
5. Who is the receiver? How will you contact them? Why have they asked you to respond?
6. What do you need to do? What is the next step?
7. What information can you give them? What would you like from them?
8. When would you like them to get back to you?
9. Is there anything you would like to add
Email 3:
John,
Here's the gist of the project:
Protein Stabilizer is needed in Rotterdam to be delivered to Amsterdam (Harbor of A) by air as soon as possible. It is urgently needed in a timely fashion as it is to be loaded onto a barge that is also leaving Rotterdam on the 12th of May. It is imperative that it be delivered to the correct location as soon as possible. 
A transport company is interested in purchasing the product, but there must be a quick and reliable way of transporting it to the barge so the payment can be made at the time of delivery. 
Shipping via air freight is the only way we can guarantee timely delivery, however it will cost approximately $120,000 to ship it to Amsterdam in an FCL pallet. (FCL is Freight Collect on Loading; meaning that a pallet is loaded on a truck and paid for at
Email 4:
Dear Mr. Barker,
 Thank you for your timely reply regarding the transportation of our product. We are extremely interested in transporting the product to the A port in the barge. We would like to request that you complete the job on the 8th May so that we may pay you on that date. 
 Please let us know if you are willing to complete the transportation of the product on the 8th of May at 9 am. 
 If the product is delivered to us, we will pay you $13,000 in cash and $3000 in product. 
 Thank you for your time and we look forward to hearing from you soon.
Email 5:
Dear Ms. Clark,
 We are sorry for the delayed response. We are very sorry, but we are unable to complete the job on the 8th of May. 
 The cost of the transportation is $5000. 
 Thank you for your time.

input_text:
Email 1:
Hello Min,                    I have a couple of inquiries that I need answered. First, could you explain to me what the procedure is to book tonnage with ACI? Second, I’m looking for vessel capacity from Singapore to Qeshm. I’ve been told that it’s really tight there right now, and you’re the best company to get us that cargo. Please let me know what your plans are for that route, and see if you can help me.                    I look forward to hearing from you.                    Regards,                    Rebecca
Email 2:
Dear Rebeca,                  Thank you for your email and I’m very happy that you are looking into opening up a new route. I can help you on that, I will be more than glad to support you for your container requirement in future. There is no route problem with Acico. I will call you for the discussion of the cargo you need and what I can do for you. Do let me know what is your closest port and whether you need TEU or FEU.                    Sincerely yours,                    Min
output_text:
From: rebecca.smith@trading.com
To: min.chen@acico.com
Subject: Inquiry: Vessel Capacity Singapore to Qeshm
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 09:23
Body: Hello Min,

I have a couple of inquiries that I need answered. First, could you explain to me what the procedure is to book tonnage with ACI? Second, I'm looking for vessel capacity from Singapore to Qeshm. I've been told that it's really tight there right now, and you're the best company to get us that cargo.

Please let me know what your plans are for that route, and see if you can help me.

I look forward to hearing from you.

Regards,
Rebecca

---

From: min.chen@acico.com
To: rebecca.smith@trading.com
Subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel Capacity Singapore to Qeshm
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 11:45
Body: Dear Rebecca,

Thank you for your email and I'm very happy that you are looking into opening up a new route. I can help you with your container requirements and would be glad to support your future needs. There are no routing issues with Acico for this trade lane.

I will call you to discuss your cargo requirements in detail. Please let me know your closest port and whether you need TEU (20ft) or FEU (40ft) containers.

Sincerely yours,
Min

input_text:
Email 1:
Hello Ms. Smith,                    Can you confirm a slot to move 2,500MT of compound from Los Angeles to Genoa?                    Best regards,                    David
Email 2:
Hi David,                    Could you please confirm that the request has been accepted?                    Regards,                    Diana

For me, email 1 is the sender's email and email 2 is the receiver's email.
For David, email 1 is the receiver's email and email 2 is the sender's email.

This type of situation is called "rank preservation" - each user sends and receives messages, but the order is not preserved. In this case, there is no one "owner" of the message, and it cannot be seen as a transaction. Because there is no agreed transaction, there is no mechanism for tracking the status of the message, so there is no way to keep track of how many emails have been sent and received.

This type of situation can be a big problem for business. A simple example is a bill that is not paid. A person may refuse to pay a bill

input_text:
Email 1:
Hello Douglas,                    Please have a carrier contact me for quoting R/T steamship cargo from Kuala Lumpur to Batumi. I need the booking done and signed by Friday to avoid demurrage.                    Regards,                    Matt
Email 2:
Dear Customer,                   Thank you for your inquiry. We would be delighted to take your order. Can you please provide the following information?                   1. Commodity:                        a. Quantity: 2. Dimension:  b. Container:                   3. Loading port:                 4. Delivery port: 5. Expected ETA:                 We will provide a detailed quote as soon as we have your details. You can expect our response in the next 1-2 working days.                  Regards,                   Matt
Email 3:
Mr. Douglas,                      Thank you for getting back to us with the information. We can make arrangements for your shipment, but we need to check if your commodities are acceptable for transport by sea. As such, we will ask our cargo experts to examine your cargo and provide you with the required advice. Please note that there are some restrictions on certain commodities, such as firearms and animal-based products, which may not be allowed for export by sea. Therefore, we will need to check these items individually to ensure that there are no further restrictions. If everything is OK, we will send you a proforma invoice for the booking.                  Kind regards,                    Matt
Email 4:
Dear Customers,                    We have examined your commodities and verified them as acceptable for transport by sea. Our representative is currently working on finalizing the booking details for you. As such, we will send you a proforma invoice shortly. Please note that this invoice is not a final confirmation of your shipment and does not commit us to any agreement until we receive a signed confirmation.                  Looking forward to your swift confirmation,                    Kind regards,                   Your Account Manager, Douglas.

input_text:
Email 1:
Hi Ms. Bernhardt,                    Would you be able to forward me the purchase order for 3,000MT of isopropanol from Houston to Brisbane?                    Thanks,                    Trevor
Email 2:
Thanks for the orders.  I’ll get them cut out.                      As a favour, can you drop us an order for        2,000MT of glycol and 4,000MT of        isopropanol        from       Brisbane       to         Singapore        ?          It’s been a pretty         slow        month       for       us       and        I         don’t         really        want        to         take        more       space      out       of      the       trucks.

<Email 3>:
Thanks Trevor.           I’ve emailed them through to Procurement and will send you copies when they’ve been approved.              Please let me know if you have any urgent changes to orders.        Thanks,

[.]
And so on

In short, you send back and forth many such emails with your suppliers to place orders, request quotes, get quotes, respond to requests, and
Email 3:
Thanks Trevor.           I’ve emailed them through to Procurement and will send you copies when they’ve been approved.              Please let me know if you have any urgent changes to orders.        Thanks,

[.]
And so on

In short, you send back and forth many such emails with your suppliers to place orders, request quotes, get quotes, respond to requests, and

<Email 3>:
 Thanks Trevor.           I’ve emailed them through to Procurement and will send you copies when they’ve been approved.              Please let me know if you have any urgent changes to orders.        Thanks,

to change prices, change specifications and otherwise run the supply side of your business.

The million-dollar question is: does this really add value?  Is it necessary to email 3,000 separate documents just to transfer about 30 minutes of information from supplier to customer? (We’ll assume that a 30-minute phone call between customer and supplier to resolve an issue is about equal to sending 3,000 emails, only once).

The answer to this question is yes, it is necessary to send emails, and no it doesn’t add value.

<Email 4>:
Thanks for your email Trevor.   You will find the purchase order attached.   Please prepare the final docs in the order

Output:
Dear Carolina,
I have some time for you here and I have some good news for you about your shipment to Brazil. We have 6,000MT of plastic granules available from Gdansk to Pecem. We have contracted with a carrier to the port and also customs clearers to have it moved out to the Pecem area. Please let me know if this shipment meets your requirements so we can continue.

Dear Paulo,
On 8/10/17 I was doing some research into specific brokerage services in Brazil. I was in contact with Ingo Geladenkamp of Andersen Cartago. He said he would provide me with a very competent and good team and he is also ISO certified. He has a good history of providing competent companies as brokers, especially for the seaborne and break bulk trades. He had not provided any other service but he has some good local contacts that are always available for the pick up of cargo in the ports of Rio, Sao Paulo, Parana and Pecem.
I sent Ingo the B/L # on 8/14/17.

• Port of Pecem

Email 2:
(Create your own text in this email. You can use the example email C if you wish.)                    Hi Pat,                    I am happy to update you on my plan to move my house deposit to you. You can now access it via the Internet Banking section of this website or download the Bankwest Mobile App. It will take me up to 2 hours to transfer the money. However, to do this securely, I will need the bank's International Code or SWIFT code. I note that you previously told me that I would not need to enter this but that the BNP Paribas website is still requesting that I do so.                   I am not sure why it is asking for the code and cannot figure out why. However, I am able to use the app but I need the code to do so. Can you please confirm this and let me know what it is?                   I have
Email 3:
If you can please provide me with the code as soon as possible so that I can move the funds and I can see my funds in the right place.                   Many thanks,                   Christine

<Email 4>
Here is the code that you can use: BNPBP22F.
I think that there is a little problem with the way that BNP Paribas is working.
You must be able to go to the Transfer Funds section of the app and make a payment with the code as above.
The reason why they are asking for the code is that when you go to Transfer Funds and click on the Pay Others section, a pop-up box appears with a box for the code.
I hope that this helps.                   Please let me know if you need anything else.

We can provide a non-binding freight quote for the cargo in FCL mode. Please note that our quoted rate excludes:
- Clearance charges
- Truck-in/out charges
- Loading/unloading charges
- VGM declaration
- Terminal and pilotage fees
- Lockage
- Vessel port call surcharge
- Detention/demurrage

Terminal handling charges will be additional, based on the service type and handling facilities required. This quote includes shipper's and consignee's transport insurance for transit operations.

Best regards,
Freight Operations Team

Mr. Rogers

Email 1:
G’day Mateo,                    Do you have any capacity for 4,000MT of rapeseed oil from Gdańsk to Aqaba by the end of May? Thanks!                    Lian
Email 2:
Dear Captain Matueo,
          Many thanks for your email. I would like to negotiate on another of your offers for ship carriage of 2,500MT of refined palm oil from Port Kelang to Algeciras by the end of May. Hope to hear from you.    Maria
______________________________________________

Shocked, nervous and excited, Matueo sent out an email asking Lian to repeat her offer. At the same time, Matueo rejected Maria’s email and immediately called his company’s head office to find out what to do. He said: “She’s got to be mad.”
Email 3:
Lian,
        I’d like to clarify your offer. I must mention that the oil cargo is still waiting for a buyer in a warehouse in London, which is already 4,000MT. The price is not competitive as the port will charge you 30 Euros/MT. Then again, the margin you make will still be around 150,000 Euros, I understand this and would like to proceed. You can provide us with the balance you will need for ship hire and insurance.    Thanks!
_______________________________________________

As instructed, the office arranged for Matueo to receive payment terms for the oil cargo and give him a booking reference for a 40,000DWT vessel bound for Port Kelang. A contract was agreed with a sample of Lian’s terms and conditions attached:

  A.    Payment on behalf of the Carrier by the Buyer. 
  B.
Email 4:
Dear Customer,

        We are pleased to inform you that we have received a full payment of $300,000 as indicated in your email. Therefore, we have duly released your cargo from storage. Please note that you will receive 70% of the total invoice by the end of this week and the rest by the end of the next week.

Your No. of: is: XXXXXXXXXXXX.

______________________________________________

1. The subject of an email is designed to notify the recipient of the contents of the email. When people receive many emails a day, it’s often useful to use subject lines that give a quick overview of the contents of the email. If the email is urgent, the subject line should indicate this to the recipient. The subject line is one of the most important parts of an email. If the subject line doesn’t reflect the content of the email, the recipient may simply ignore the email.

input_text:
Email 1:
Dear Capt. Bailey,                    Can we schedule 10,000MT of kerosene from Daesan to Sikka on Apr. 20? I’m open to a laycan as late as 22. Also, will it be possible to adjust freight if loading completes ahead of schedule?                    Very best,                    Norma
Email 2:
Dear Mr. Caplan,                      I want to tell you we moved 10,000 MT of kerosene from Daesan to Palembang and our agent said it was a light discharge of 6,000MT and charged a C/I discount of $500MT. Can you give me another estimate?                    With Best Regards,                    Norma

Dear Mr. Caplan,                    Yes, I can give you another estimate. Please find our estimate below.                    Very Best,                    Norma
Email 3:
Dear Mr. Caplan,                    Thank you for your estimate. We will schedule the cargo from Daesan to Palembang and can move the shipment before Apr. 20. Also, I’d like to schedule another load of 10,000 MT of kerosene from Daesan to Timor Leste or Belawan but not Far East.  If you can adjust the freight and laycan, it will be fine.                    Very best,                    Norma
Email 4:
Dear Mr. Caplan,                     We moved 10,000 MT of kerosene from Daesan to Palembang and would like to go back to Daesan to load 10,000MT of kerosene on Apr. 27. Can you go to Daesan for us?                    With Best Regards,                    Norma

Dear Mr. Caplan,                     Yes, we can go to Daesan for you. Also, we can send a lighter from Port Said to Crewe because the gross weight of our largest tanker exceeds 80,000 MT. Please see our estimate below.                    Best Regards,                    Norma
Email 5:
Dear Mr. Caplan,                     Thank you for your estimate. I’m happy to hear we will get rid of our light load of 4,000 MT. We have other C/P that require another load. We can go to Daesan on Apr. 28 to load 10,000MT.  Thank you for your help.                    Best Regards,                    Norma

Norma

From: melissa.smith@company.com
To: andrew.jackson@logistics.com
Subject: Coal Transport Route Query - Felixstowe to Rotterdam
Timestamp: 2023-07-10 09:15
Body: Dear Ms. Jackson,

Could you let me know what is the leading inland point for coal from Felixstowe to Rotterdam in July?

I hope to speak with you soon,

Melissa

---

From: andrew.jackson@logistics.com
To: melissa.smith@company.com
Subject: Re: Coal Transport Route Query - Felixstowe to Rotterdam
Timestamp: 2023-07-10 11:30
Body: Dear Melissa,

There are a variety of ways to get coal to Rotterdam:

The first is rail from Felixstowe to The Hook where it is loaded onto barges.
The second is by sea.

However, the leading inland point for coal from Felixstowe to Rotterdam in July is via rail.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Sincerely,
Andrew

Best regards,
Sarah

Email 1:
Hello Mr. Smith,                    I am a Senior Purchaser with Superkoala Steel, and we need a supplier that can supply steel coils from China to Spain in bulk. Does your company have the capability to service this requirement, and what would you quote for the same?                    Cheers,                    Aaron
Email 2:
Thank you very much for your interest. I can assure you that our company will be able to meet your requirement as our company has experience in exporting to European countries. We are a long established business and are also registered under Indian Company Act. We are into the business of exporting Steel Re-rolls. Our company has a modern state of the art plant with a 100-tonne capacity meltshop, quality control laboratory, a high efficiency submerged arc furnace with automatic control, hot rolling plant, cold rolling and coil/coke drive services. We are in the position to supply only superior quality steel to customers.  We can supply Iron Ore as well as Scrap. Our facility can also produce a maximum of 3,000 tonnes of Hot Rolled Coils per year for the International Market. We will always supply 100% Made in India products. Currently we have the capacity of producing 1,000
Email 3:
I look forward to hearing back from you very soon.

From: aaron.purchaser@superkoala-steel.com
To: smith@steeltrading.com
Subject: Steel Coil Supply Inquiry - China to Spain
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 09:30
Body: Hello Mr. Smith,

I am a Senior Purchaser with Superkoala Steel, and we need a supplier that can supply steel coils from China to Spain in bulk. Does your company have the capability to service this requirement, and what would you quote for the same?

Cheers,
Aaron

---

From: smith@steeltrading.com
To: aaron.purchaser@superkoala-steel.com
Subject: Re: Steel Coil Supply Inquiry - China to Spain
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 14:45
Body: Dear Aaron,

Thank you very much for your interest. I must clarify that we are an Indian manufacturer, not Chinese. Our company has extensive experience exporting to European countries and is registered under the Indian Company Act.

We operate a modern state-of-the-art facility with:
- 100-tonne capacity meltshop
- Quality control laboratory
- High efficiency submerged arc furnace with automatic control
- Hot rolling plant
- Cold rolling and coil/coke drive services

Our annual production capacity is 3,000 tonnes of Hot Rolled Coils for the International Market, with current availability of 1,000 tonnes. We supply only 100% Made in India products of superior quality. We can also supply Iron Ore and Scrap materials.

Best regards,
Mr. Smith

Subject: Re: Steel Coil Supply Inquiry - China to Spain
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 16:20
Body: I look forward to hearing back from you very soon.

input_text:
Email 1:
To Lina
Email 2:
This email is regarding something that happened at
work today. A new female intern who was under
your supervision was fired. To summarize, she walked
in late this morning, was complaining about not
having anyone to work with, and was generally
complaining about everything. The only thing you
could do was tell her that you had already met with
the rest of the team and had already assigned them
to the projects. Then she proceeded to say how she
could probably solve all of these problems because
she was so smart. You proceeded to give her the
option to go home to think about it, but she kept
insisting she was intelligent enough to handle the
situation. She finally left to go home, which was
good.

Lina,

There is something you need to know about me.
Although it’s unusual for me to use my first name
output_text:
From: robert.smith@company.com
To: lina.chen@company.com
Subject: Re: Incident with New Intern
Timestamp: 2024-01-23 14:30
Body: Hi Lina,

I wanted to bring to your attention a situation that occurred today with the new intern under your supervision. She arrived late this morning and displayed concerning behavior. When informed that project assignments had already been distributed during the morning team meeting, she became argumentative and made several inappropriate comments about her superior capabilities.

When given the option to take the rest of the day off to reconsider her approach, she continued to be confrontational. Though she eventually left the office, I believe this warrants immediate attention.

Regards,
Robert

---

From: lina.chen@company.com
To: robert.smith@company.com
Subject: Re: Incident with New Intern
Timestamp: 2024-01-23 15:15
Body: Robert,

Thank you for bringing this to my attention. I should mention that I typically go by my Chinese name in professional settings, rather than my English name. This might help avoid any confusion in future communications.

I'll address the intern situation first thing tomorrow morning.

Best regards,
Li Na

input_text:
Email 1:
Good morning Capt. Garcia,                    I want a 20’ container to move from Monterrey to Laredo on the 8th. What’s your base freight?                    Thanks for your time,                    Russell
Email 2:
Thanks for your call earlier.                    Would you mind taking a look at the email I sent you to see if you can help me with a pricing quote for the movement of a 20’ container from Monterrey to Laredo?                    Thanks,                    Russell

What are some of the examples we see that should be avoided?
Emails that end with a question mark?  Why?
Placing calls at 6:30 am for an urgent message (too many?).  Why?
Emailing with too much detail or excuses (less interesting)?
Texting without emoticons, etc. (different feel and look).  Why?
Emails that start with “My apologies for reaching out to you by email….”  (Don’t make excuses for email, get to the point in the subject line, 1 ^{st} sentence, etc.)  Why

input_text:
Email 1:
Hi Mr. Ghosh,                    I need to send out 1,600MT of 36% urea to Lagos. What’s your quickest route? I’d prefer to use one of your DP2 vessels, but am willing to try your DP1 as well. Are there any CMA CGM ships passing by Lagos this weekend?                    Hope to hear from you soon,                    Narun
Email 2:
Thank you for your email and inquiry. It is difficult to serve one destination, like Lagos, with one service, since there are a number of ports in Africa, some with different schedules and times. Depending on where your cargo is in India, you may or may not have a vessel coming into the subcontinent to Lagos. You can check the arrival times for Lagos on our website by using the Port Schedule Search Tool here: https://cma-cgmschedules.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/    CMA CGM offers a variety of services which vary by region, sometimes even by port. If you want to know what services are available in Lagos, you can check out our Schedule Explorer website and use the same search tool mentioned above to find the service schedules for Lagos: https://www.schec-cma-cgm.com/schec/node/en/lagos    For other ports on the
output_text:
From: narun.patel@trader.com
To: aditya.ghosh@cma-cgm.com
Subject: Urea Shipment to Lagos - Vessel Inquiry
Timestamp: 2024-02-15 09:30
Body: Hi Mr. Ghosh,

I need to send out 1,600MT of 36% urea to Lagos. What's your quickest route? I'd prefer to use one of your DP2 vessels, but am willing to consider DP1 as well. Are there any CMA CGM ships passing by Lagos this weekend?

Hope to hear from you soon,
Narun

---

From: aditya.ghosh@cma-cgm.com
To: narun.patel@trader.com
Subject: Re: Urea Shipment to Lagos - Vessel Inquiry
Timestamp: 2024-02-15 11:45
Body: Dear Narun,

Thank you for your email and inquiry. Due to the multiple ports we serve in Africa, we operate several different schedules to Lagos. The availability of vessels depends on your loading location in India.

I recommend checking our Port Schedule Search Tool for specific arrival times in Lagos:
https://cma-cgmschedules.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/

For detailed service schedules to Lagos, please visit our Schedule Explorer:
https://www.schec-cma-cgm.com/schec/node/en/lagos

Kind regards,
Aditya Ghosh

- Final destination: Halifax

Alex

- Rate: USD 4.00 per metric ton from Bremerhaven
- Additional USD 1.00 per metric ton for Lagos pickup

Best regards,
Robert Martinez

Alex

Email 2:
> Dear Charles,  Yes, it’s confirmed! I’d recommend to choose Neptun (NEO3), which is a hybrid vessel with very low port draft. There’s no draft limitation for NEO3 when discharging in the deepwater port.                    Best regards,                    Tiffany
Email 3:
> Dear Tiffany,      Thanks for your quick response. For the product I’m going to import (yarn and socks, very bulky), which port would you recommend for discharging and costing me least in terms of draft and manpower? Thanks!                   Best regards,                    Charles
Email 4:
> Dear Charles,  If you can afford to spend time in the port, we’d recommend leaving the vessel out for 4 days in Nanjing (Nanj). This will allow the vessel to reach maximum draft in Nanjing and improve its discharge efficiency. Since Nanjing has less costs on one side (manpower and cargo handling) and Shanghai on the other (draft and terminal fees), we’d recommend you to start the discharging from Nanjing. From: tiffany.zhang@oceanfreight.com
To: charles.wong@tradeimport.com
Subject: Re: Palm Oil Shipment Quote Request - Antwerp to Shanghai
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 10:45
Body: Dear Charles,

Yes, it's confirmed! I'd recommend choosing Neptun (NEO3), which is a hybrid vessel with very low port draft. There's no draft limitation for NEO3 when discharging in the deepwater port.

Best regards,
Tiffany

---

From: charles.wong@tradeimport.com
To: tiffany.zhang@oceanfreight.com
Subject: Re: Palm Oil Shipment Quote Request - Antwerp to Shanghai
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 11:30
Body: Dear Tiffany,

Thanks for your quick response. For the product I'm going to import (yarn and socks, very bulky), which port would you recommend for discharging and costing me least in terms of draft and manpower?

Best regards,
Charles

---

From: tiffany.zhang@oceanfreight.com
To: charles.wong@tradeimport.com
Subject: Re: Palm Oil Shipment Quote Request - Antwerp to Shanghai
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 13:15
Body: Dear Charles,

If you can afford to spend time in the port, we'd recommend leaving the vessel out for 4 days in Nanjing (Nanj). This will allow the vessel to reach maximum draft in Nanjing and improve its discharge efficiency. Since Nanjing has less costs on one side (manpower and cargo handling) and Shanghai on the other (draft and terminal fees), we'd recommend you to start the discharging from Nanjing.

Best regards,
Tiffany

Email 3:
Thank you very much for your prompt reply.                    We can place orders now and ship our 2,000 MT Methanol now. I have all of the following payments now, can I just send you bank details in an email?                    Regards,                    Kory
This email chain was revealed by 2016 WikiLeaks release. The same email chain was used as an example by 5th column coconspirator Caroline Wiliams in a social media blog.

# Financial Data Leak
As 3 years ago I warned, and have explained 1012 ways to use & abuse the leaked data, this data leak (only 0.1% of total) has been misused & is now used against financial institutions, and there are legal provisions to do so (the cases against banks using unsecured websites can be found by Google searches).

There are laws in many countries and in
Email 4:

Hello Kory,                    This will be a follow up email on Mr. James's previous email.                    The best option for payments is PayPal, however I cannot make any decisions on our behalf.                    Regards,                    Marcus
Marcus is the example name for an ICIS representative from the website, not from the published lists. There was no password because it was a website registered by ICIS.

Marcus' website was created by ICIS and it's use was designed to collect emails and data to fill their database. They did so by offering very little for the cost of the raw data. They used the data collection method to create email lists and email addresses.

Email 1:
Good evening Mr. Galloway,                    I know you are working in China, so I want to take your advice about importing commodities from China. How do I get them and from where do I get reliable data for prices, delivery dates and duty implications?                    With best wishes,                    Michael
Email 2:
<Received Date and Time>: 17th April 2012
<Your Date and Time>:
Dear Sir,
In this connection, I wish to place on record, as it's been more than 6 months that Mr. Gupta met me as referred by his colleague Mr. Kalidas and personally with Mr. Gupta too. Now we are in touch for a long time. That's why I am writing you again to find out if you still have any goods which you wish to place with Mr. Gupta. If so, let me know as soon as possible. Your response in this regard would be highly appreciated.
<Your Date and Time>:
Dear Sir,
In connection with our earlier correspondence, I would like to let you know that I am having tremendous difficulty locating Mr. Gupta's office, mobile number and even the complete address of his organization (as he gave me to deliver his
Email 3:
Good afternoon Michael,

I wonder how you are doing. It is a wonderful experience to meet you. I hope that you enjoyed your time in China and are planning for a future visit. I would be pleased to support you when you visit again. I suggest that you might get more insight into China’s complex trade environment and efficient business practices by visiting again. In the future, please do not hesitate to contact me to know more details and I will be pleased to share the experience I have. Hereby, I am forwarding the list of our clients who we are still working with. I look forward to hearing from you.

Please feel free to contact me for more information and tips about China’s trade environment.

<Your Date and Time>:
Dear Sir,
I am writing in connection with the reference of Mr. Gupta of Gurmeet Gupta & Co., who has recommended me for the purpose of your import
output_text:
From: michael.smith@business.com
To: james.galloway@tradeconsult.cn
Subject: Advice on Chinese Commodity Imports
Timestamp: 2012-04-16 20:30
Body: Good evening Mr. Galloway,

I know you are working in China, so I would like to seek your advice about importing commodities from China. Could you guide me on reliable sources for pricing data, delivery schedules, and duty implications?

With best wishes,
Michael

---

From: james.galloway@tradeconsult.cn
To: michael.smith@business.com
Subject: Re: Advice on Chinese Commodity Imports
Timestamp: 2012-04-17 09:15
Body: Good afternoon Michael,

Thank you for reaching out. I'm pleased to assist with your inquiry about Chinese imports. I believe visiting China would give you valuable insight into our complex trade environment and business practices. I would be happy to support your visit and share my experience.

I'm attaching a list of our current trading partners for your reference. Please feel free to contact me for more specific information about pricing, logistics, and regulatory requirements.

Best regards,
James Galloway

Email 1:
I’m trying to reach you in reference to your request for a quote on an oil and gas loading from Los Angeles to Singapore.                            We understand the tight deadlines we’re facing on this one, so we wanted to get this quote to you as quickly as possible.                            We’re 48 hours out from the best offer we can make, but it’s very tight given the number of different specifications you’re working with, and it could all come down to which vessel can get to Los Angeles and be there on time.                            We’re currently looking at the container ship M/V Santa Rosalia, but its ETA to Los Angeles is still TBD.                            If we can get a firm ETA for the vessel, we can proceed with firm details.                            Please let me know when the vessel ETA will be finalized.                            I apologize for the short time frame, and we’ll do our best to make it
Email 2:
We were hoping for your timely response on the quotation for your bulk oil cargo shipment from Los Angeles to Singapore. I have to mention that we are running extremely tight on the time frame. The reason is that we are due to deliver the cargo to our end customers by mid-June, but we only received the order last Friday.                            It’s very unusual that we are facing such tight deadlines, but our clients always rely on us to deliver promptly and to the highest quality.                            I wanted to check if the container ship M/V Santa Rosalia is still available to be your vessel for the shipment. I see that the vessel is in Shanghai right now, but we are working closely with the charter company to get the vessel to Los Angeles as quickly as possible.                            I also wanted to check if the vessel ETA has been finalized. If it has, I would be very grateful if you could please let
Email 3:
Here is the contract price you requested for your bulk oil cargo shipment from Los Angeles to Singapore. You’re right, we have no better options to choose from, but we’re holding out for a better offer. We’ve been monitoring the freight market very closely, and there’s been a lot of activity in the last few days. We believe it’s only a matter of time until we find a better offer.                            It’s difficult to be as competitive as we need to be while we wait for better offers, so we wanted to present you with this deal that is currently available.                            If we have any better offers to come in, I will let you know. It’s only been a few hours since I reached out to you, so I hope you understand if this offer isn’t perfect.                            Again, thank you for your continued patience and understanding. We truly appreciate it and we’re doing our

Sean

Subject: Re: Kolhe Ignition Tube Proposal
Timestamp: 2001-09-12 10:15
Body: Dear Sean,

Regarding your inquiry of September 10th, I can present our current offer:

Kolhe is prepared to supply 1 million ignition tube kits at $100 per unit (standard price $200), provided you commit now. Additionally, we propose a follow-up order of 500,000 kits at $1 million total, plus a long-term commitment for 10 million tubes annually at $200 each.

This arrangement would secure Kolhe's revenue stream until we establish our own production capacity.

Best regards,
Bill Gates

Email 1:
Mark,                    The 700MT of kerosene you’re shipping is due to arrive in Las Palmas. Could you please let me know when to expect the cargo?                    Sincerely,                    George
Email 2:
Dear George,
                    This is a follow-up regarding our order of 700MT of kerosene. Please let me know if there are any problems with the shipment, and let me know if you have any questions about the products.                Regards,
                Kyle


In an email, the subject line informs the receiver that the cargo will be delivered soon. The second email is a follow-up message regarding the 700MT of kerosene ordered from the seller. In both the messages, there are informal terms of address such as "Mark" and "George" used. There are also many instances of informal salutations such as "Dear" and "Sincerely" used.
Email 3:
Mark:
                     In my experience as an executive, sending out a clear, well-structured email is important in communicating your message to the right audience. Your recent message to the sender of the cargo was one such example. The structure was clear and concise, making it easy for the receiver to understand. The only mistake you made was to address the receiver using their first name rather than the title of their position. You could have easily addressed him as “Mr. George”, but I guess you wanted to be more informal. Regardless, the main message was conveyed and you managed to make the whole process as straightforward as possible.
                Regards,
                Eko

In the email above, the receiver has explained to the sender how he should have addressed the sender of the cargo. He is correct about the sender not addressing the sender by his full name instead of the title. The main point of the email is

input_text:
Email 1:
Dear Mr. Shan,                    We are shipping 33,000L of ginger essential oil from San Francisco to Taipei in 12” drums. We’re hoping to use your refrigerated containers, since it’s a perishable product. Is this possible?                    Kind regards,                    Kate
Email 2:
Dear Kate,
Thank you for your email, we’re delighted to hear from you and are happy to assist.                   The best type of refrigerated container is an ISO Container, which is a specially designed shipping container. These can hold temperature sensitive products of all kinds. As an example, we’ve shipped over 80,000 cartons of liquid chocolate spread for one of the UK’s largest chocolate makers, and shipped 11,000 cans of spray paint from Belgium to the UK.                    We can provide you with a full ISO container for your ginger essential oil, which will ensure that it arrives at your destination in perfect condition. We can pick the container up from your warehouse, and deliver it to your preferred shipping port. Your oil is safe with us.                    Thanks again for getting in touch, if you have any more questions or queries, please don’t hesitate to get in touch. Kind regards
Email 3:
Hello,                           I was wondering how much a dry ice shipment would cost to ship from Chicago to Hong Kong. Would a 20ft container be needed?                    Kind regards,                    Stacy

<Email 4>:
Dear Stacy,
Thank you for your email.                            The dry ice shipment you’re referring to is a refrigerated container. We’ve shipped 10,000 cans of spray paint, and 6,500 l of flour, from the UK to Denmark, in one such container. In order to do this, we need an ISO container.                        ISO stands for International Standards Organisation. The body that standardises the design of shipping containers. ISO containers have many advantages over other types of container, in particular their air tight seal, which means that they can be filled with dry ice (or any type of refrigerant) and frozen to a very low temperature. Sincerely,                 AOE Ops                                    13856 Jones Hollow Road        Suite 1032               Lancaster, OH 43130         United States

Hey! This was going to be a quick follow-up email as you had mentioned it at our last meeting. I hope this finds you well and thanks for your time.                I need a solution for our client ASAP and I was wondering if you could have a quote for me within the next few days.                I would like to share some additional info with you, namely:                They are in need of 3 X 12,500DWT Bunker / Chemical carriers with a double skin system. The vessel should have at least 7 km/h to 8 km/h operational speed and a high maneuverability.                Furthermore, if possible, the vessel would be ideal if it was designed to include a furnace for the production of liquefied hydrocarbons.                The Bunker / Chemical carrier should be able to dock at a loading and unloading facility in the Ulsan industrial complex

Subject: FW: Opportunity for solution proposal               Dear Mr. Farrokhi,                We are pleased to be in touch with you and have the pleasure of responding to your initial request from a few days ago. We have many years of experience in creating and providing unique solutions that are tailored to the specific requirements of our clients.                We believe our technology and method of service have grown immensely since we last met, and with our enhanced and tailored service, we are sure we will be able to deliver a solution tailored to your requirements.                I hope this changes your view and we can share more details as soon as possible.                With kind regards,                AOE Ops                                      13856 Jones Hollow Road             Suite 1032               Lancaster, OH 43130         United States

Email 2:
Dear Yang,                    I hope you had a pleasant day.  Thanks for your reply, but we are currently engaged with other producers in Xiamen, and we are not able to offer you a consolidated shipment from there. Our current rate is 7% per ton from Xiamen port to Macau port, which is very competitive compared to other suppliers.                    Regards,                    Rania


## Learning Goals

• Write and send professional, dynamic, and creative emails

## Materials

• A sample email from our previous text in "Sending a Message: Email"

## Discussion Questions

1. Does the second email above respond to all of the questions in the first? How do you know? Explain.
2. What is the best response to this email? Explain.
3. Let's say this is a sample email that we want to send to a friend asking about a weekend trip.

To: yang.liu@xiamenports.cn
Subject: Inquiry: 3,200MT Pumice Aggregate from Xiamen

Body: Dear Yang,

I hope this email finds you well. We are looking to source a consolidated cargo of approximately 3,200MT of pumice aggregate from Xiamen. Could you please confirm availability and provide your freight rates for delivery to Macau?

We would need the vessel to be ready by the 23rd of this month.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Rania

---

To: rania.ahmed@trading.com
Subject: Re: Inquiry: 3,200MT Pumice Aggregate from Xiamen

I regret to inform you that we are currently handling commitments with other producers in Xiamen and cannot accommodate a consolidated shipment at this time. However, for your reference, our standard freight rate from Xiamen to Macau is USD 7 per ton, which remains very competitive in the market.

Regards,
Yang

I am writing again as I haven't heard from you. The Shoutzu representative in Durban has reported some issues with my previous container of frozen beef, which makes me hesitant about sending future shipments through your agents. I'd like to understand what happened and discuss how we might proceed.

Any advice or suggestions would be appreciated.

Kind regards,
Gloria

---

From: ryan.smith@logistics.co.za
To: gloria.martinez@trading.com
Subject: Re: Concerns regarding previous shipment
Timestamp: 2024-06-14 16:45
Body: Dear Gloria,

I received your email.

I have received an offer on the Tender in Japan and am currently in discussion with Mr. Nakano at Asahi Kasei. We hope to resolve this soon and will keep you informed.

Please reference invoice #461664 from Durban for your records. I will provide a formal quote for customs clearance upon my return from overseas next week. Before that, you'll need to make a payment toward terminal charges due to container discharge delays. This has now been rectified and the documents are being processed.

Best regards,
Ryan

Hi Ken,                    We were recently contacted by one of your old customers regarding their past experiences with FOB shipments. We have prepared a short report and have attached it here. Feel free to take a look.                    In case you require any other information please let me know.                    Warmest regards,                    Anja
Email 2:
I have reviewed your email dated December 2, 2019 and would like to clarify. We were never contacted by one of your old customers regarding our past experiences with FOB shipments. As such, I do not understand how we were ever in receipt of a short report and an attachment of the same. While we will always value the opportunity to assist in any way we can, I do not feel that this is an appropriate way to present a point of view, particularly without providing any facts to support your position.                    I am happy to say that we do not stand on the side of FOB shipments. We have always insisted that cargo arrives fully insured, regardless of shipping method, and all cargo is insured for its full value when leaving the warehouse. Ken

input_text:
Email 1:
Email B                    When will you be available for a meeting?                    Patrick
Due to the complexity of these tests, they need to be run in the laboratory. Preparing a lab experiment for this type of request may take several hours. Hi Andre,                    I’d like to load 9,000MT of rapeseed oil from Hamburg to Casablanca. The earliest demurrage would be $15k. Can you send me a freight quote?                    Cheers,                    Seamus
Email 2:
Andre,                      Thanks for the quote.                    The ship can’t leave for two weeks, so I’ll extend the demurrage. Do you have the shipping rate yet?                    Cheers,                    Seamus

<Email 3>:
Andre,                    Hi there,                    I see you have a shipping rate. My ship’s coming in the next two days. We can demur for the full 21 days and ship in 15 days. Would you kindly quote this rate for me, please? Thanks.                    Seamus

<Email 4>:
Seamus,                    Hi there,                    We can ship your product at this rate. Could you have the purchase order or documents ready by Friday?                    Thanks,                    Andre

The two fields to change for the above sample are:
# Project name
WORKFLOW_NAME = 'new-shipment-order'

# Subject title
WORKFLOW_SUBJECT = 'A Quick Shipment Order'

In this sample, the subject is already written, but it is in a variable. If we want to change the subject, we only need to change the value of WORKFLOW_SUBJECT. However, if we want to add a line to the subject, the code will change to something like this:

WORKFLOW_SUBJECT = 'Last Update on {reviewed_on}: {workorder.name}. Please verify.'


If we want to change the subject line to include a date, we would need to insert a loop

Hello Dr. Osipoff,                    I have seen your forwarding schedule through Rotterdam and asked several of my customers who had loaded through your terminal recently. I have been informed that they have been very pleased with the service levels. I am wondering if there is any way that we can organize a dedicated appointment for one of our ships that is looking to dock there in early June?                    Best,                    Mike
Email 2:
Thanks for your message regarding your approach to a scheduled call. 
We will contact your office at that time.

Message 3: 
<Jul 2/07>  
I will let you know as soon as I have an appointment. Thank you very much for taking our request into consideration.
 Message 4: 
<Aug 27/07> 
We are very pleased that you will be able to confirm an appointment with your office at this time. Our customer is not finding any available appointments in your terminal for the early September time frame. We are looking to book a call in the first week of September. Again, thank you for your service.

     </end of email list>


Logically enough, there was no response from your customer to either of your replies. But it is good to keep trying. If a customer has important business they want to do,  you do not want
Email 3:
<Hi Bill,
     We have forwarded to you the attachment you requested and would welcome an opportunity to meet with you in the future to discuss your concerns.

Regards,
Gerrit Moors
North Holland Terminals BV>
Email 4:
<Dear Gerrit,

<Hi there, We were wondering if we were able to see your work schedule so we could plan out our loading dates with your office. Thanks, 
Mike>

<Hi Mike,
     Please find attached a spreadsheet which shows the NHT Rotterdam calling schedule for 2008 and 2009.

<attachment>: Please find the attached listing of the NHT Rotterdam schedule for 2008 and 2009.

    Regards,        Gerrit Moors

<Note: the attachment was not there>

I have made no attempt to find out what is going on, because I do not want to waste another minute.

What I do not understand is what happened in the preceding six weeks of email exchanges. If you take a close look at the
Email 5:
<Hi Mike,
     We have had our schedule altered and I am afraid that the slot in question is no longer available at this time. Perhaps we can look at one of the others on the attached listing?

Regards,
Gerrit Moors>
<Note the attached list was not there>
files, you can see that there is a problem with the attachment of files to the email messages.

First, consider that there were six weeks of delay between the first email and the fourth. Where in the world are these files that have already been sent to you? I would expect to get a reply that way.
Second, while the text of the message has been altered, the content of the second message is not actually in the first one. There is no way to get the attachment file from my
end of email list> what happens when I try to open the files.

Hi Mr. Fitzgerald,                    We’d like to ship 18,000MT of hot-rolled steel coils from Ambarava to Lima, what’s the best way to do it?                    Best regards,                    Ashley
Email 2:
Hello again,                           I’m still not certain that I understand exactly what you’re asking. Are you looking to charter a ship? Or ship the cargo via container?                    I can answer either question. My apologies for not understanding.                        Ash

[Note: This is a common problem. We have candidates who enter code to simulate sending an email, but fail to email the employee.]
```
[Script]
Sub Main()

    Const oApp As Object = CreateObject("Outlook.Application")
    Const oNs As Object = oApp.GetNamespace("MAPI")
    Const oNsf As Object = oNs.GetDefaultFolder(6)

    Dim oEmail As Object
    Dim oMsg As Object
    Dim oRecip As Object

    Set oEmail = oNs.CreateRecipient("ashley@certifiedcand.com")
    oEmail.Resolve

    Set o

Subject: Steel Coils Shipment Query - Ambarawa to Lima

Body: Hi Mr. Fitzgerald,

We'd like to ship 18,000MT of hot-rolled steel coils from Ambarawa to Lima. Could you please advise on the most suitable shipping option?

Best regards,
Ashley

---

From: fitzgerald@shipping-broker.com
To: ashley.smith@tradeco.com
Subject: Re: Steel Coils Shipment Query - Ambarawa to Lima
Timestamp: 2024-02-15 11:45
Body: Hello Ashley,

I need to clarify your requirements to better assist you. Are you looking to charter a vessel for bulk shipping, or are you considering container shipping for this cargo?

I can provide options for either method once you confirm your preference.

Best regards,
Fitzgerald

Next step is to contain the crude and give it to companies that have orders for oil. (it’s important to know that there are huge oil companies like Chevron that have 40% of all oil of the gulf being scooped out)                    So, your email is looking for dispersants, and how can we help you get that by. We will also need to have the vessel there
Email 2:
So what kind of dispersants can I be looking for? (have an infograph with several different chemicals and examples) 

                              When we are discussing crude oil and dispersants, how will we be able to control the path of the product when used as a dispersant?

                          <Email 3>:
                              Thanks for your questions, we have a bit of dispersant in storage, we have the chemicals in a stockpile and have the dispersants ready for dispatch. The pathway to the dispersant is controlled by dispersing into the water column (using either chemical dispersants or in-situ burning). We have tried in-situ burning on some (its not approved but will be tested later) The main problem with the chemical dispersants is controlling the depth and concentration in the water column. With in-situ burning you are able to control the depth of burning, and as it has
output_text:
From: john.miller@cleanupops.com
To: s.ambrose@dispersants.net
Subject: Gulf Oil Spill Cleanup - Dispersant Requirements
Timestamp: 2023-08-15 09:30
Body: Hi Ms. Ambrose,

I'm writing regarding the ongoing cleanup operations in the Gulf of Mexico. Following my site visit this weekend, I wanted to discuss our dispersant requirements for the oil spill remediation effort.

We estimate needing approximately 40,000 tons of chemical dispersants for the removal operation. As you may be aware, major companies like Chevron are currently handling about 40% of the crude oil recovery in the gulf region.

Could you please provide information about your dispersant availability and vessel deployment capabilities? We need to ensure proper coordination for both the dispersant delivery and application.

Best regards,
John Miller

---

From: s.ambrose@dispersants.net
To: john.miller@cleanupops.com
Subject: Re: Gulf Oil Spill Cleanup - Dispersant Requirements
Timestamp: 2023-08-15 11:45
Body: Hello John,

Could you specify which types of dispersants you're looking for? Also, I'd like to understand your plans for controlling the dispersant application path once deployed.

Regards,
Sarah Ambrose

---

From: john.miller@cleanupops.com
To: s.ambrose@dispersants.net
Subject: Re: Gulf Oil Spill Cleanup - Dispersant Requirements
Timestamp: 2023-08-15 14:20
Body: Hi Sarah,

We currently have some dispersant stockpiled and ready for dispatch. Our application method involves dispersing into the water column using either chemical dispersants or in-situ burning. While we've conducted some preliminary in-situ burning tests (pending approval), our main challenge with chemical dispersants is controlling depth and concentration in the water column. The advantage of in-situ burning is better depth control during the process.

Best regards,
John

Hello Ivan,                    We’re looking at 15,500MT of MGB xanthate from Port Klang to Los Angeles. Could you please include ocean and inland rates in your quote, as well as the vessel schedule?                    Regards,                    Jun
Email 2:
Please find the attached the price list and freight terms & conditions for your reference.                     Kindly let me know which terms and conditions do you need so I can arrange it with the sales head for approval.                      Thank you,                      Ignacio

<Email 3>:
Hello Jun,                    I just have a quick question, we have previously agreed that T & C are mutual subject to clearance. I’m a little concerned that the EPC terms may exclude customs clearance. I will need to forward to the buyer for approval.                    I will revert when I have a clearer understanding of this.                    Cheers,                    Ivan

<Email 4>:
Thank you for your email. Please do not worry because that kind of terms and conditions are subject to clearance and the customs clearance charges are an on cost so it will not effect the final FOB.                    Hope this clarifies your question.

The exact quantity of drums (50 or 100) can be determined according to the truck availability, and we are requesting for only 2-3 deliveries for the entire quantity. The offer for delivery for the full quantity will be given only if possible. The DUM is to be picked up by the customer or by a 3rd party and the customer is to be held fully responsible for the quality of the DUM and the shipment.                    Kind regards,                    Manager
Email 2:
Dear Ahmed,                    This is to confirm that we will deliver the 100 DUM in total to you within one week and to collect from Khartoum International Airport. You are to issue a credit note for 35% and a cash payment for the rest. You are to pay to our firm with hard cash.                    Kind regards,                    Manager
\end{code}

The desired output of the script would be something like this:

\begin{code}
Email 1:
        Dear Ahmed,
          This is to inform you that I can deliver 1,000mt of IAEA classified DNP in DUM 250# drums, via truck and air. The exact quantity of drums (50 or 100) can be determined according to the truck availability, and we are requesting for only 2-3 deliveries for the entire quantity. The offer for delivery for the full quantity
Email 3:
Dear Ahmed,
          This is to confirm that we will deliver the 100 DUM in total to you within one week and to collect from Khartouum International Airport. You are to issue a credit note for 35% and a cash payment for the rest. You are to pay to our firm with hard cash.
\end{code}

And so on

Comment: Your question is not clear at all. The code seems working fine for me.

Comment: @Gaurav Interesting, I get this error: KeyError: 'ClientEmail'

Comment: can you check the code in the first line of the `if` statement of `if` the next statement `try:
    email = result['ClientEmail']

        except Exception as e:
            print('Error:',e)

Comment: What is the full traceback? It probably indicates that one of the `Emails` is
Email 4:

      <Unnamed>
      <com@gareth eorportable.co.uk>

Comment: See [my answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/60897195/5587982) to get the full details.

Answer: From the information provided, it looks like your keys are incorrect. Each field is an email address and is a part of `emails`. However, your code is looking for `"ClientEmail"` in the result instead of `emails`.

Instead of:

\begin{code}
if result.get('ClientEmail') is not None:
\end{code}

Try:

\begin{code}
if result.get('emails') is not None:
\end{code}

From: accounts@logcon.com.au

Subject: Invoice Discrepancies - Colombo Deliveries

Body: Dear LCL Operator,

Best regards,
Accounts Department

Email 1:
Dear Jason,                    Could you please quote the best rate for carrying 2,000 MT of crude oil from Nigeria to Antwerp.                                As the company would like to discuss the possibility of chartering the vessel, laycan must be before May 20th.                    Regards,                    Christina
Email 2:
Dear Jason,                   Just to confirm, that the rates for the tanker UAM ARTHUR are Euro 5.00/day.                               Please respond with a summary of the terms and conditions on FOB basis.                    Regards,                    Christina


Scenario: 
You are working as a Marketing Officer in a Tanker Management Company. Your client, Global Oil and Gas company, has a requirement to charter a tanker. 

 

You have to handle all enquiries and prepare quotations for your clients. The company has offered to deal directly with the client, based on your recommendations. 
The company has a database of over 50 tankers and has been in the shipping industry for the past 20 years. 
You have decided to use the scenario-based approach to meet the clients requirements. 

You will be using a Case Study Template that has been provided to you as a spreadsheet.
Email 3:
Dear Jason,                    Could you please send me a message as you have not replied to my request regarding the best rate for carrying 2,000 MT of crude oil from Nigeria to Antwerp.                            The laycan is between May 20th and May 24th.                    Regards,                    Christina

Scenario: Christina has not received any response from Jason after sending Email 3, above. 
As a result, she starts to search the internet. She searches Google with the question “best price to charter a tanker”. She finds a web page with the relevant information. 
She clicks on the “rate quote” link on the webpage and it leads her to another webpage which shows various options for the company that she is working for. 

 

The company has several oil tankers that it can offer and can handle all the requirements for the client. 

 

Send Christina the following email and send
Email 4:
Dear Christina,                    The owner has confirmed the availability of our tanker, UAM ARTHUR. She will be available for hire from May 22nd and will return on June 3rd. She is currently on hire and, therefore, requires 8 days for demurrage.                    Regards,                    Jason

 

 

Scenario: 
The UAM ARTHUR is not currently on hire. You have to make the necessary arrangements for the loading of the tanker. 

 

The client wants the oil to be shipped as “Floating, Lighter, Single (FLOS)”. The company has the relevant tankers. 

 

Suggested procedure:
 
- Meet your team to discuss the requirements of the client in more detail. They need to be aware of the procedure to be followed.
- You will have to coordinate and oversee the steps and ensure that the requirements of the client are met
Email 5:
Dear Christina,                    We have met the client’s requirements and can load the oil by FLOS. The loading will be at the Berth C at Lagos. There will be a requirement for marine services and an environmental impact assessment will be needed.                    Regards,                    Jason


Scenario: The team is now discussing the process to follow and finalising the logistics plan. 
The Marine Surveyor and the Coordinator will be working on a report. They have a meeting and are going to visit the client’s premises to finalise the report. 
The Coordinator will liaise with the Marine Surveyor for any updates. 
The Environment Manager will liaise with the team to ensure that all the necessary steps to comply with the requirements are taken.
 

The Coordinator and the Marine Surveyor have had a meeting with the client. The Marine Surveyor has given his report and has taken photographs and measurements of the berth
