Email 4:
Thank you for your enquiry.                   Regarding your first query, if you have two destinations and only want to travel once per cargo item and your freight exceeds 3,000kg, there will be a minimum charge of $5,000 to open up your freight as Standard Charters freight (see the link below for full information).                   Regarding your second query, the Standard Charters will be 40 days turnaround per trip and for the return leg from airport to airport we will allow up to 5 days turnaround. Generally 3-4 days should be enough time to collect your cargo, unless of course you want to wait and collect together.                   Kind regards,                   Vassili Kakias  Contact Us | Privacy Policy | Terms of Use | Terms of Sale | Cookie Policy Let us call you back Select this option for a callback from one of our representatives. × This option is no longer available
output_text:
From: ray.smith@tradeco.com
To: stuart.crossthwaite@chartering.com
Subject: STP Paper Shipment Barcelona-Casablanca Query
Timestamp: 2024-01-02 09:15
Body: Hi Stuart,

Would you be able to confirm your earliest date for an STP for 3,000MT of paper from Barcelona to Casablanca? Also, do you charge for your expert judgment to advise us on the terminal rules?

With best regards,
Ray

---

From: vassili.kakias@chartering.com
To: ray.smith@tradeco.com
Subject: Re: STP Paper Shipment Barcelona-Casablanca Query
Timestamp: 2024-01-02 11:30
Body: Dear Ray,

Thank you for your enquiry. I am sorry but at this time our Operations team has no availability until January. Our charter rates can be viewed on the rate page on our website. These rates are subject to Standard Charters Terms & Conditions.

Please note the rates are offered only on a per direction basis, with allowance for a few days turnaround at sea between outward and return legs. There is no charge for our expert advice on terminal rules. We will contact you once availability has been confirmed and our rates have been reconfirmed.

Kind regards,
Vassili Kakias

---

From: kurt.wagner@tradeco.com
To: vassili.kakias@chartering.com
Subject: Re: Express Charter Consolidation Query
Timestamp: 2024-01-02 14:45
Body: Dear Vassili,

I trust you are well. I was hoping you could help me regarding some queries:

1. Is it possible to combine freight items on an express charter, and if so, what rates apply?

2. We would like to consolidate 3 flights of around 500 kgs each on one flight to reduce costs and delivery times. Would 3-4 days be a reasonable request time for this service?

Kind regards,
Kurt

---

From: vassili.kakias@chartering.com
To: kurt.wagner@tradeco.com
Subject: Re: Express Charter Consolidation Query
Timestamp: 2024-01-02 16:20
Body: Dear Kurt,

Thank you for your enquiry.

Regarding your first query, for freight exceeding 3,000kg with two destinations on a single cargo journey, there will be a minimum charge of $5,000 to process as Standard Charters freight.

For your second query, Standard Charters operates on a 40-day turnaround per trip, with up to 5 days allowance for the return leg from airport to airport. Your suggested 3-4 days should be sufficient for cargo collection, unless you prefer to wait and consolidate shipments.

Kind regards,
Vassili Kakias

Email 1:
Sven,                    I’d like to schedule 11,200MT of bitumen from Rotterdam to Trieste. I’ve got plenty of time to load it in, so it doesn’t have to be a rush. Any price ideas?                    Regards,                    Andy
Email 2:
Andy,                    Ahhh, Rotterdam, my old hometown. My dear, dear old home.                    That bitumen sounds like it was made for me. Thank you very much for your message.                    How about 8 million euros for the deal?                    I would like to give you a discount for you letting me call you “m’darling” in your email. But I’m afraid I won’t be able to do it if you let me pay the freight. I think you’ll forgive me?                    Sincerely,                    Sven
Email 3:
Sven,                    How about I give you a week to arrange delivery of this bitumen and then come back to you with a price.                    If I am successful, will you discount my shipping cost with the discount I would have received if you’d paid?                    I look forward to hearing from you.                    Regards,                    Andy
output_text:

To: sven.nielsen@freightline.com
Subject: Bitumen Shipment Rotterdam-Trieste
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 10:23

I'd like to schedule 11,200MT of bitumen from Rotterdam to Trieste. I've got plenty of time to load it in, so it doesn't have to be a rush. Any price ideas?

Regards,
Andy

---

From: sven.nielsen@freightline.com
To: andy.smith@tradingco.com
Subject: Re: Bitumen Shipment Rotterdam-Trieste
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 11:45
Body: Andy,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the bitumen shipment. Being from Rotterdam myself, I'm quite familiar with the route.

I can offer a freight rate of 8 million euros for the complete transportation. While I'd like to offer a preferential rate, I'm afraid I can only do so if the freight is prepaid by your side.

Let me know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Sven

---

To: sven.nielsen@freightline.com
Subject: Re: Bitumen Shipment Rotterdam-Trieste

I'll need a week to arrange everything on my end. Once that's sorted, we can discuss the final price.

Regarding the discount - would you be willing to apply the same preferential rate to my shipping costs that would have applied if prepaid?

I look forward to hearing from you.

Regards,
Andy

The cargo for Dar es Salaam is not going ahead because of the lack of market liquidity.                    Best,                    Rami
Email 2:
I received your email yesterday and after further research the market is not a threat for the shipping of the furniture, this issue was one of hundreds of issues that delayed the start of operation. We are currently in the process of getting the full list of issues and how we plan on fixing them. We will include this in the full presentation that will be sent to you in 2 weeks. 


Thank you for taking the time to assist in getting the furniture off the plane and even considering doing something about it. I have informed your colleagues of your situation. We are all greatful.
Email 3:
Hello,
If you do have more emails or maybe questions just let me know and I would be happy to assist. I can help with fixing issues like this. 

It's not enough to have a great idea. You need to have something that gets people excited about it and helps them think about it in a new way.


Maybe it is more than just a simple solution but it's all worth it in the end. 

If there is anything I can do to help, please feel free to reach out. Thank you.
Email 4:
Here is the delivery order:
1. $50 for shipping - please send directly to Seattle.
2. $80 for payment and taxes - please send directly to Dar es Salaam
3. $50 for initial hire - sent to both Seattle and Dar es Salaam

Please make sure to send in the order you received it or else the finances will become problematic.

Thank you for your help,
Malia

Thank you for taking the time to answer my question, and I truly appreciate it.

Thank you.

Rami

input_text:
Email 1:
Mark,                    How about 3,300 MT of gelato from Naples to Melbourne? Should we start as a cargo hold, or can we split that 3 MT between the reefer plug and cargo hold?                    Best,                    Daniel
Email 2:
Excellent work today, guys. As I understand it, you've pre-bought 3,000 MT of gelato from Naples for the flight to Melbourne.                       We are going to have it arrive in Australia in time for the festival. We have until October, so we have plenty of time.                    Now, if you ask me, it would be much better if the gelato arrived as a part of a shipment of napolitan foodstuffs from Naples, or a plane with a load of gelato from Naples arriving in Australia. But whatever works, Daniel.                    I would also like to order more gelato from Naples for our festivals in the future, as demand seems to have picked up since we started this thing. And before you ask, yes, there is a limit on gelato purchases from Naples. After all, the flood of gelato was somewhat unexpected.                    Unfortunately,
Email 3:
Perhaps one day a three-car train will bring a smaller batch of gelato to Australia, but not today.
Email 4:

Daniel

---

From: mark.wilson@tradingco.com
To: daniel.smith@globalcargo.com
Subject: Re: Gelato Shipment Query - Naples to Melbourne
Timestamp: 2024-02-01 10:30
Body: Excellent work today. I understand we've secured 3,000 MT of gelato from Naples for transport to Melbourne.

We need to ensure delivery before the October festival, so timing isn't critical yet. I suggest we consider incorporating this into a larger shipment of Neapolitan foodstuffs to optimize logistics.

Given the increasing demand, we should explore additional gelato orders from Naples for future festivals, though we need to be mindful of the supplier's production limits.

Regards,
Mark

---

From: daniel.smith@globalcargo.com
To: mark.wilson@tradingco.com
Subject: Re: Gelato Shipment Query - Naples to Melbourne
Timestamp: 2024-02-01 11:45
Body: Mark,

Noted on the larger shipment suggestion. While rail transport might be an option for smaller quantities in the future, it's not viable for this volume.

Regards,
Daniel

---

From: mark.wilson@tradingco.com
To: daniel.smith@globalcargo.com
Subject: Re: Gelato Shipment Query - Naples to Melbourne
Timestamp: 2024-02-01 13:20

We need to consider the local market preferences. Given that some Australians prefer traditional ice cream over gelato, how should we adjust our distribution strategy?

Mark

---

From: daniel.smith@globalcargo.com

Subject: Re: Gelato Shipment Query - Naples to Melbourne
Timestamp: 2024-02-01 14:45

We'll focus on commercial distribution for the majority, but I propose donating a portion to hospitals and nursing homes, particularly in Western Australia, to build goodwill and market presence.

Daniel

---

From: mark.wilson@tradingco.com
To: daniel.smith@globalcargo.com
Subject: Re: Gelato Shipment Query - Naples to Melbourne

Excellent suggestion. On a related note, I'd like to propose the Matilda Forest Festival - a three-day celebration of music, dance, and food. This could become a significant international event and provide an excellent venue for our gelato distribution.

Regards,
Mark

The Port of Jebel Ali

<Email 4>:
is an excellent option for your cargo to Dubai.
Email 5:
Can you let me know what the freight rates to Jebel Ali and Dubai are?

Thanks,
Sam"""
```

```python
letter_3 = """Dear Sir,
I'm looking to arrange an opening of an account with your company, because I think we can work together in the future. Can you send me the details?

Thanks,
Fari"""
```

Next, we are going to send the letters to the different addresses. You can send any email to the receiver with a variation of the email. Let's add all the addresses in a list:

```python
addresses = ['recep@company.com', 'address2@email.com', 'address3@company.com']
```

And now, send the emails:

```python
for address in addresses:
    if address == 'recep@company.com':
        with smtplib.SMTP_SSL('smtp.gmail.com', 465)

input_text:
Email 1:
Hi Ms. Wood,                    We have 300MT of varnishes to ship from the port of St. Louis to New Orleans, and I'm waiting on your spot rate, and are you also handling documentation?                    Thank you,                    Maria
Email 2:
Dear Maria,                    Unfortunately I do not ship varnishes to the New Orleans area and would prefer not to. That being said if I do a search of my available inventory and find anything that is suited to your needs, I will contact you immediately.                    If however it's just another product you are shipping that's not on the Hotwire system, I'd be more than happy to assist you. I can make sure you get the correct documentation and arrange for the import.                    In either case, let me know if you have any questions. Have a great day.                    Maria
Email 3:
Dear Ms. Wood,
First off I would like to say I appreciate the prompt response in regard to my last email. I see you have some inventory available, but they do not meet my shipment's needs. If I were to contact you about something different would it be a problem? That being said I am a consultant in the logistics industry and my services are always free of charge and as per the contract there is no obligation to you to purchase through my companies.  There are many people out there looking to cut costs in logistics and I can get them better rates than you can. 
That being said I have contacted a gentleman in New York that could get me the varnishes to Louisiana if needed. Now for my question. I'd like to give you a call sometime next week to review my rates so you know how I can assist you with your shipments. I really want to help,
Email 4:
Hi Maria,
Thanks for the call and the offer to help. It is always a good idea to learn from the competition and see if there are ways to improve. Here's the problem though, with someone giving a 'free quote' on a project there is no commitment to us, which means they have to do whatever they have to do to get that deal. I'm sure they're better than Hotwire, but they will lose you and then we have to deal with you again. That's why I'm so hesitant to send quotes to people I don't know.
I do hope we'll keep in touch and maybe, sometime, we'll see if I can't help you on a project.
Email 5:
Ms. Wood,
Dear Ms. Wood,
I was sorry to hear you are not interested in helping me, but if you are interested in consulting me about any way to improve my shipping cost I am always open to any ideas. I would appreciate if we could at least start off with a friendly email. I am glad you offered help, but you might want to consider to not offer help and save yourself some time. Thank you and have a good day.

You may see that the language in the Email 3 is totally different compared to Email 1 and 2.  How do we know that they are from the same shipper and shipper are looking for our services?
Email 3 contains the same piece of information as in Email 1, but have different sentence structure (i.e. punctuation, verb structure). We therefore know that the shipper is the same company, as they are interested in the same commodities. However, some stakeholders in the industry believed the language is not the same. This is because each company, even the same company, have different style and tone when they email their clients or vendors.

To: nick.wong@shipline.com
Subject: Rice Shipment Hong Kong to Qingdao
Timestamp: 2024-01-02 09:15
Body: Hi there,

---

From: nick.wong@shipline.com
To: david.chen@tradingco.com
Subject: Re: Rice Shipment Hong Kong to Qingdao
Timestamp: 2024-01-02 10:30
Body: Hi David,

I understand you're seeking a shipping line for your rice cargo. Given your January 10th deadline, I can propose several routing options.

The key factors we need to consider are:

2. Vessel availability at Hong Kong port

Best regards,
Nick

To: brian.moynihan@shipping.com
Subject: Base Oil Shipment Request - Rotterdam to Singapore
Timestamp: 2024-03-28 09:15
Body: Hello Mr. Moynihan,

I was wondering if you had the capacity to move 8,000MT of base oil from Rotterdam to Singapore? We have a laycan of April 5th and are looking to make this commitment.

Thank you,
Wendi

---

From: wendi.chen@tradeco.com
To: brian.moynihan@shipping.com
Subject: Re: Base Oil Shipment Request - Rotterdam to Singapore
Timestamp: 2024-03-28 14:30
Body: Dear Mr. Moynihan,

I hope this email finds you well. I am following up regarding the 8,000MT of base oil shipment from Rotterdam to Singapore. The laycan remains April 5th.

We have updated the trading route to Europe > Asia. I have attached the latest tank instructions and will forward you a PDF copy of the contract shortly.

Please note that the current contract expires on March 31st at 3pm Singapore time. I would like to discuss the possibility of extending this deadline to allow all parties sufficient time to complete the necessary documentation.

Best regards,
Wendi

---

From: brian.moynihan@shipping.com
To: wendi.chen@tradeco.com
Subject: Re: Base Oil Shipment Request - Rotterdam to Singapore
Timestamp: 2024-03-29 08:45
Body: Dear Wendi,

Thank you for your emails. I need to review the new contract before proceeding further. The April 5th laycan is quite tight given the current timeline.

Regarding the Europe > Asia route, I need to understand your specific requirements. Would you consider routing through North America as an alternative? We could arrange shipment via either US or Canadian ports if that would be more feasible.

Please send the new contract for review as soon as possible.

Best regards,
Brian Moynihan

input_text:
Email 1:
Hi Nate,                    I’m writing to follow-up on your quote from yesterday. We’re looking at loading 3,600MT of vegetables from Bangladesh to Malaysia. What do you think about my counter-offer of $60/MT DAP?                    Regards,                    Anneli
Email 2:
Thanks Anneli,                  I think you can sell the bananas at this rate. It’s been an average couple of months for the coffee beans and dairy products, but we should get you a 10% rate increase for those. You may want to increase your seasonal rate for oranges, though, since the fruit is looking unusually good this year. The offer is yours. I’ll be in touch with you about this payment by the end of the week.                    Sincerely,                    Nate

These emails demonstrate the following key features of email negotiation:
* The use of emotional language to create rapport, such as “I think” or “it’s been an average couple of months for the coffee beans and dairy products.” This indicates that the sender is likely well-informed and experienced in the industry.
* The use of repetition to highlight key points, such as the “3,600MT of vegetables
Email 3:
Thanks Anneli, I appreciate your feedback. I have submitted the request to our systems for approval. I’m sorry to hear about your upcoming sale. I’m hoping we can be a better partner for your business in the future.                Sincerely,                Nate

<Email 4>:
Thanks Nate, I really appreciate your feedback. It’s been a rough couple of months for the company and our operations have been hit hard by inflation. I’m hoping we can still work together in the future and be a reliable source for your clients.                Sincerely,                Anneli
This email demonstrates the following key features of email negotiation:
* The use of “I” statements to take personal responsibility and not blame others for any problems, such as “It’s been a rough couple of months for the company.”
* The use of repetition to emphasize key points, such as “I’m

Hey there!                I'm sending a quick follow-up to my last inquiry regarding open time-charter's for wheat cargoes from West Africa to Europe and Gulf States.                I'm aware that the demand for open time-charter vessels is not strong, but I am looking to contract out a few (5-10) vessel open time charters at this time to capture the market.                I would appreciate it if you would keep me in mind, as well as recommend any other ports and/or vessel operators that you have connections with.                Thank you for your time.            -Sincerely,            Brian

Email 4:
You have found my name on a shippers website. Thank you for your inquiry, but I'm looking for something else.
Email 3:
Hi Charles,
Thanks for your email, but the market right now is focused on spot trades, and contracts with a short duration of 3-6 months.
Looking forward to working with you again,
Tony

In this list of emails, we'll explore how to improve the above email, and how to create a more effective approach to reaching out to potential contacts.

## Email 1

### What's Wrong

- Longwinded introductory paragraph
- Little information about what they are asking
- Is the ship going to pick them up or do they have to go to a terminal
- No mention of price expectations

### How To Improve

- Condense the introduction by only including the information that is important
- Add a clear expectation of what they want from the recipient
- Add expected FIO quote
- Provide specific information about the pricing so they know what they are working with
Email 4:
You have found my name on a shippers website. Thank you for your inquiry, but I'm looking for something else.
<Email 3>:
Hi Charles,
Thanks for your email, but the market right now is focused on spot trades, and contracts with a short duration of 3-6 months.
Looking forward to working with you again,
Tony

## Email 2

### What's Wrong

- The recipient doesn't know what the sender is trying to convey
- The sender is vague in their request
- Has no idea about any relevant information

### How To Improve

- Start with the end in mind by clearly stating what the request is and what the time frame for the request is
- Offer something in return such as an FIO quote

Email 1:
Dear Ms. Yoon,                    Could you provide a freight estimate for 1,250 MT of crude palm oil from Tanjung Priok to Yangon in early October? Do you foresee any port draft limitations?                    Best regards,                    Mandy
Email 2:
Hi Mandy,                         We have three vessels on order to begin operating in Yangon this week, so no doubt there will be port draft restrictions, but we're in no position to commit to a certain percentage.                    We are able to ship your cargo in 25,000 MT increments, and we would be delighted to work on a finalised shipment for you in early October.                    Kind regards,                David

<Email 3>:
Hi David,                      Thank you for the freight estimate, but could you please provide the estimated minimum draft requirement for each vessel? We'd like to compare your draft to what other carriers are requesting.                    Thanks,                Mandy
Email 3:
Hi David,                      Thank you for the freight estimate, but could you please provide the estimated minimum draft requirement for each vessel? We'd like to compare your draft to what other carriers are requesting.                    Thanks,                Mandy

<Email 3>:
 Hi David,                      Thank you for your kind response.  We now understand there will be a reduction in capacity at Yangon in early October, and we can definitely accommodate your vessels.  However, we are having trouble finding accurate draft information, and we'd like to make sure we're getting our quotes to our customers as soon as possible.                    I'm assuming there will be no difference in draft requirements for our other vessels, and I'm also assuming the draft is the same for all ships.                    Could you please let me know the information I need to provide to my customers in order to get accurate quotes?                    Thanks,                Mandy
Email 4:
Hi Mandy,                      The exact minimum draft will be determined by when each vessel comes into Yangon, as we have a range of charterers and we can't possibly ask for 24 separate quotes. We will try our best to give you quotes, but the degree of variation is dependent on what we are able to procure on the spot.                    It's currently being confirmed that we will not be able to access the shallow draft ports, so that would be off the table for your vessels.  Once we've confirmed what we can provide, we'll get back to you.  Please don't hesitate to contact me directly with any questions.                    Best regards,                David
Email 4:
Hi David,                      Thanks for the information!  We'll be waiting to hear back.                    Best regards,                Mandy

Another way to send email and get a response quickly is by using live chat. This is an instant messaging service that allows you to send messages to people who are online at the same time as you. Body: Dear Mr. Wang,

Thank you for your quote on the 22,500MT shipment of P20 alloy steel from Wuhan to the UK.

I need some clarification on a few details:
1. Will delivery include transport to our warehouse in England, or is it port delivery only?
2. Could you please specify our laycan dates?

Best regards,
Wang Li

Email 1:
Hi Johan,                    We’re interested in 700MT of fertilizers from Livorno to Kavala. Could you send your rate ideas, and is your vessel flexible on partial loading windows?                    Sincerely,                    Alexis
Email 2:
Johan,                     Yes, we can do the whole quantity. We are wondering what is your  [FAO]FAO is an abbreviation for "Feed Online" ; used as an email announcement to alert others that there are new items in the database. You need to register to create FAOs, otherwise you will receive automatic notification for this email  for partial loading windows?                   For Livorno you could come with all your cargo and berth in the 08-10 days of March. We could take it later or first if we need more vessels before that date.                   For Kavala you could come with all your cargo or take it in the 01-05 of April and for the rest the ship could berth in the 05-07 of April or in any day  of the month. I will send a message to our Chief Technical Officer asking him if our vessels can load
Email 3:
Date: Mon, 1 Jan 2018 12:34:04 +0200
To: Sendan <sendan@myemail.com>
Subject: Re: Kavala - Livorno
Hello, dear Alexandros. I just heard you again. Your letter of inquiry  surprised me. Is that serious? Livorno-Kavala? Or not serious? At  [FAO]FAO is an abbreviation for "Feed Online" ; used as an email announcement to alert others that there are new items in the database. You need to register to create FAOs, otherwise you will receive automatic notification for this email , I can sell no more than 50 tonnes per month. It's the common trick of a small ship like mine. The rest is only green paper. So, you are the first one I received in last 10 years. From Kavala
output_text:
From: alexis.broker@shipbroker.com
To: johan.vessel@shipping.com
Subject: Cargo Inquiry: Livorno-Kavala Fertilizers
Timestamp: 2018-01-01 10:30
Body: Hi Johan,

We're interested in 700MT of fertilizers from Livorno to Kavala. Could you send your rate ideas, and is your vessel flexible on partial loading windows?

Sincerely,
Alexis

---

From: johan.vessel@shipping.com
To: alexis.broker@shipbroker.com
Subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry: Livorno-Kavala Fertilizers
Timestamp: 2018-01-01 11:15
Body: Dear Alexis,

Yes, we can accommodate the full quantity. For Livorno, we can berth between March 8-10. Earlier dates might be possible depending on vessel scheduling.

For Kavala, we can offer two options:
- Full cargo discharge during April 1-5
- Split discharge between April 5-7, or other dates during the month

I will confirm vessel technical capabilities with our CTO and revert.

Best regards,
Johan

---

From: johan.vessel@shipping.com
To: sendan@myemail.com
Subject: Re: Kavala - Livorno
Timestamp: 2018-01-01 12:34
Body: Hello Alexandros,

I must clarify something regarding your inquiry. For shipments between Livorno and Kavala, our vessel can only handle 50 tonnes per month due to size limitations. This is the first such inquiry I've received in 10 years for this route.

Best regards,
Johan

output_text:
From: operations@genoa-port.it
To: customer@shipping.com
Subject: Urgent: Cargo Release and Off-hire Time Settlement - B/L #59751
Timestamp: 2017-02-14 09:30
Body: Dear Valued Customer,

A bale with a gross weight of 70,000 kg is currently awaiting delivery at pier 7 in the port of Genoa. This commodity was imported aboard your vessel 'JCM SCANDALING', under bill of lading #59751.

The freight forwarder has requested payment prior to cargo release. Additionally, there appears to be a discrepancy in the calculation of port and sea days, resulting in an underpayment of off-hire time.

We kindly request your immediate attention to:
1. Address the freight forwarder's payment request
2. Review and settle the off-hire time calculation

Please respond at your earliest convenience to avoid any further delays.

Best regards,
Port Operations Team

---

From: logistics@enea-gmbh.de
To: customer@shipping.com
Subject: RE: Bill of Lading Update - 560,000 MT Shipment
Timestamp: 2017-02-14 14:45
Body: Dear Valued Customer,

Following our earlier communication, we confirm that we will process the bill of lading for the 560,000 Metric Tonnes shipment at our office:

ENEA GmbH
Sennestringer Str. 17
29522 Drensteinfurt
Deutschland

The bill of lading will be issued within 7 days, contingent upon receipt of payment via bank transfer to our designated account.

Please don't hesitate to contact us for any additional information.

Best regards,
ENEA GmbH Logistics Team

---

Kind regards

Email 2:
Thanks Melissa, I’ll have our team look into this for you. Could you please send us the following:                    -Order type: 1. "Forward-to-Shore" 2. "Lift-On/Lift-Off" 3. "Shore-to-Shore"                    -Cargo Volume/Weight                    -Route, Origin, Destination, and Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA)                    -Prefered Carrier Names for each shipper and carrier per lane
We look forward to working with you soon!
Kind regards,
John

Terminal Details:
-   Port Name: Marseille Fos
-   Carriage Zone: Customs
-   Free Zone Type: Central Customs Zone
-   Free Zone Entry/Exit: None required
-   Additional Information: 20FT containers: dimensions 12' 2'' x 7' 2'' x 8'
Email 3:
Dear Eddy,              I’d like to know more about your terminal in Fos, Marseille.              Specifically, I’d like to understand your entry/exit procedures for containers.              Do you have a free zone?              And, what does a 20 foot container’s dimensions look like?              Thanks!              Regards,              Sam
Email 4:
Thanks Sam, we have two terminals in Fos, Marseille:                      -Fos-Port Express Terminal:                       This terminal is ideally situated at the maritime Port of Fos, and is only a short walk from the Marseille/ Provence Airport, only 45 minutes away, to the North.                       It is the perfect base to distribute goods to the following countries: Italy, Portugal, Spain, Germany, Ireland, the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Greece, Finland, Malta, Luxembourg, Switzerland, Austria and the United Kingdom.                       Here, we offer both a sea and an air access point, including access to the MED terminal with two docks for 40’ and 20’ shipping containers.                         We’re also one of the few terminals in the area that can accept high cube containers on all of our shelves.             -Fos-Port International Terminal:           This terminal is easily accessible

input_text:
Email 1:
Hey David,                    Looking to move 5k mt of vegetable oil from Limbe to Beirut. Could you give me an indication of freight, and is laytime negotiable beyond 42 hours?                    Cheers,                    Priscilla
Email 2:
Hey Priscilla,
The Port Authority charges a draft of $1000 for Limbe and 60 hours for lay time. If you can agree to a lesser laytime we can cut the draft a bit.  If I may be of further assistance to you please don't hesitate to contact me.               Best Regards,              David


​
We can find an example of an email from a product manager showing proof of how important it is to accurately record internal communication. When the product manager shows the email to the VP of business development, she may have a lot of excuses for missing the date in the subject line. But, if she doesn't record communications, she could easily miss some data as well. In this instance, the VP has a copy of the email the product manager sent, so it's on the record. Of course, one of the keys to the process is to send

*/

#### Just Read Emails from the “Inbox” of One Account, Automatically with Jsemail

Jsemail is a library to get emails from Gmail or Outlook inbox as Python dictionary or CSV files. Jsemail also runs on Windows and macOS (for Outlook), and it is independent of any GUI tool like Thunderbird. Jsemail can be easily extended to work with other email services.

Jsemail is written as Jupyter Notebook and available on GitHub. Just install the requirements and run Jsemail jupyter notebook. You can either email the generated report or copy the contents.

<Email 3>:

# Email2：强调邮件标题的作用
```
Dear Mr. Weich,
 I wish to discuss further with you regarding the delivery of oil products to Kavala in July. How can we arrange for further discussion? 
 Regards, 
 James
```
Email 3:
Dear Mr. Weich,                   I’m interested in doing business with your company, what’s your leading products? How to contact you?                   Regards,                   Fiona

# Email2：强调邮件标题的作用
```
Dear Mr. Weich,
 I wish to discuss further with you regarding the delivery of oil products to Kavala in July. How can we arrange for further discussion? 
 Regards, 
 James
```

<Email 3>:
 Dear Mr. Weich,
 I’m interested in doing business with your company, what’s your leading products? How to contact you? 
 Regards, 
 Fiona
```
类似的邮件可以代替长篇之邮件。 
 下面列举五个最常见的邮件标题，其作用是：
（一）认可和恭维对方
```
```
```
I am delighted to hear from you. 
 I am pleased to receive your message. 
 I will be delighted to receive your reply to my letter.
```
```
（二）暗示
```
```
I am looking forward to hearing from you. 
 I look forward to receive your reply soon. 
 I look forward to meeting you soon.
```
```
（三）期待对方的合作
```
```
I would be pleased to cooperate with you.
Email 4:
Dear Mr. Weich,                   It is a great pleasure to know that you are interested in my company. 

Our leading products include: cement, powder paint, water treatment agent, etc. 

For your requirement of inquiry, you can also check with the following website:
http://www.crane.chem/
I look forward to establishing business cooperation with you! 
My best regards,                   Fiona
```
（四）交代
```
Thank you for your interest. 
 You needn't reply to me again as we can solve all our matters by phone. 
```
```
（五）谈及工作或前期的设想
```
```
I have to leave early this morning. 
 I shall be in Athens next week. 
 Next month, I will be on tour to Brazil. 
```

Email 2:
Dear Mr. Weich,

From: rates@cargoservices.com
To: santiago@tradingco.com
Subject: Sugar Shipment Cost Calculation - Santos to Libreville
Timestamp: 2021-05-17 09:30
Body: Hello Mr. Santiago,

Your demurrage invoice for 8,000MT of sugar from Santos to Libreville has been calculated based on the following factors:

Bulk Carbon Rate: $0.14/Metric Ton
DP Charge: $4,700
Demurrage: $3,100
Total Due: $8,014.80

For your consideration, an alternative scenario of 8,000MT at $0.12/Metric Ton would result in:

Bulk Carbon Rate: $0.14/Metric Ton
DP Charge: $4,700
Demurrage: $0.75/Metric Ton
Total Due: $8,014.80

Recommendation: Please consider using a 9,000MT bill of lading for optimal pricing.

Best regards

---

From: notifications@bankruptcy.court.gov
To: stakeholders@list.court.gov
Subject: Case 21-20326: 3DAYLY LLC Bankruptcy Filing
Timestamp: 2021-05-17 10:00
Body: Notice of Bankruptcy Filing

On April 27, 2021, 3DAYLY LLC and its related entities and affiliates ('Debtors') filed voluntary petitions for relief under Chapter 11 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code in the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York.

The Debtors operate a worldwide customer delivery company across five industries: transportation (trucking), e-commerce (last mile delivery), financial technology (crypto-currency payments), hospitality and transportation (chauffeur services). The company maintains a fleet of 800,000 vehicles and is headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut with operations throughout North America.

---

Timestamp: 2021-05-17 10:20
Body: I apologize for the delay in sharing the requested email details. I will send the complete information shortly. Please let me know if you have any questions about the Bill of Lading selections.

Best regards,
Andie Soliani

I talked to my client and asked her to look into finding a better cargo for our next shipment.                      Thanks,                    Eva
Email 3:
Dear Eva,
Your clients ask me to inform you that there is no spot cargoes going to Las Palmas, but if the 7,100MT is enough, it's not too bad. The 7,100MT is what our client need as it's the minimum load size for their buyer.                       The next issue we have is the routing, the kerosene cargo coming from Rotterdam to Las Palmas should have changed its routing to Tangier to cover a higher proportion of distance and fuel saving. The amendment is not allowed, and it's not a good thing.                       We have got a ship who can load cargoes for you in two weeks, if we make it, will you be able to get the cargo and load it in the time frame? From: mark.broker@shipbrokers.com
To: eva.trading@trader.com
Subject: Re: Kerosene Cargo Confirmation - Rotterdam to Las Palmas
Timestamp: 2023-09-01 11:45
Body: Dear Eva,

Your clients ask me to inform you that there are no spot cargoes going to Las Palmas, but if the 7,100MT is enough, it's not too bad. The 7,100MT is what our client needs as it's the minimum load size for their buyer.

The next issue we have is the routing - the kerosene cargo coming from Rotterdam to Las Palmas should have changed its routing to Tangier to cover a higher proportion of distance and fuel saving. The amendment is not allowed, and it's not a good thing.

We have got a ship who can load cargoes for you in two weeks. If we make it, will you be able to get the cargo and load it in the time frame?

Regards,
Mark

---

Thanks,
Eva

---

Our client told me that they will have to use the same routing as the kerosene cargo. I suggest if you can take it, and let's try to find a better load for our next shipment.

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask.

Regards,
Mark

 ##News >   ##Instructions > "Checking out with the payment method <code>eventstoredb<code> failed: No order number available due to <code>limit=50<code>."

This warning message was triggered when you executed the [TriggerModule.SaveOrderAsync](/docs/api/eventstore-triggers/TriggerModule) trigger module in the Event Store SDK. The event trigger module creates an order number based on the process id and some event identifier, and can’t create orders if the order limit has been reached.

You can choose to ignore the message, but make sure that your triggers are working properly, or adjust your trigger settings.

An order number is needed for the transactional store. Make sure to set an order number, for example by using the [TrackingModule](/docs/api/eventstore-triggers/TrackingModule). See the [Tutorial: Business Event Order Processing](

input_text:
Email 1:
You have a new job! Well, not really – but you will write several emails in a short time to say “hello” to the new company you’ve been offered.                    The question is: Are you interested in the job? Of course, you’re not going to say “no”, but what tone and language will you use? Can you see any difference between these two emails?                    Are these just plain English? If so, the person reading your email will ask him/herself, “so what’s going to make this job different from all the other jobs you’ve had?”                    Or, do you want to sound more professional? Think of someone else at the company you admire and ask, “how would this person sound?”. You want to be taken seriously, so why not use this role model to guide your language and style.                    First – address the person correctly
Email 2:
1. Dear Mr. Goldie.
2. Dear Mr. Ron Goldie.
3. Dear Sir,

The last one is bad. Even if you don’t know the title of the person you’re writing to, you should find out. It is just poor manners to call someone “Sir” when you know his/her title is “Mrs.”. Of course, you can only find out his/her title if you have been given that information by the human resources department – so how would you know to address him/her that way? (The answer is – you won’t. But if the company does not give you that information, call the person “Sir”).

Second – when should you write an email?
The choice of email or letter will depend on the nature of the situation and your relationship with the person you are addressing. There are some circumstances where the choice of email and letter is similar
Email 3:
Some emails are going to be shorter than a letter. If you are writing about a job offer you probably will use an email, rather than a letter. If you send a letter instead of an email, it might take several weeks for the employer to respond and you might not hear back from them at all.

<Email 4>:
Or perhaps you are simply giving the other person an apology. If it is a formal apology that will be sent to a formal address – to an official with a title, you will probably use a letter.

Third – address the subject matter.
Are you describing your qualifications for the job? Are you apologizing for being late for an interview or for the need to reschedule an interview?

It is better to be specific and complete.

Fourth – what tone of language should you use?
A formal email will be written in a professional tone, expressing confidence and taking responsibility
Email 4:
Or perhaps you are simply giving the other person an apology. If it is a formal apology that will be sent to a formal address – to an official with a title, you will probably use a letter.

Third – address the subject matter.
Are you describing your qualifications for the job? Are you apologizing for being late for an interview or for the need to reschedule an interview?

It is better to be specific and complete.

Fourth – what tone of language should you use?
A formal email will be written in a professional tone, expressing confidence and taking responsibility

<Email 4>:
 Another factor to consider is the formal or informal language you choose to use. Would a form letter (or would the form letter say a form letter) send the right message?

Fifth – making the connection.
Just as you should have a similar style of introduction for a letter, an email should open with a similar introduction and an invitation to read your email through to the end. Here’s an example of a less than ideal opening email:

Dear Mr. Goldie,
I would like to inform you that a final decision has been made about the hiring process and I need to come to London to continue the recruitment process on the 12th of November. I will be leaving Paris on the 11th at 1 pm. I will be going by train and I will reach Paris Nord at 6.30. I would be very grateful if you could arrange a car and driver to collect me

Body: Dear Candidate,

As you prepare to apply for positions within our company, we wanted to provide some important guidelines about professional communication.

When writing your application emails, consider your tone carefully. While you want to show enthusiasm, maintaining professionalism is crucial. Consider how someone you admire in the industry would communicate, and use that as a model for your own correspondence.

Best regards,
HR Team

From: hr.team@company.com
To: candidate@email.com
Subject: RE: Job Application Guidelines - Proper Addressing
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 09:35
Body: Important note regarding addressing hiring managers:

When addressing your application emails, please use the following format:
- Preferred: 'Dear Mr. Goldie' or 'Dear Mr. Ron Goldie'
- Avoid using generic 'Dear Sir/Madam' when possible

If you're uncertain about the recipient's name or title, please contact HR for clarification.

Best regards,
HR Team

---

From: hr.team@company.com
To: candidate@email.com
Subject: RE: Job Application Guidelines - Communication Methods
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 09:40
Body: Regarding communication methods:

For job applications and initial correspondence, email is the preferred method of communication. This ensures prompt response and efficient processing of your application.

Letters are more appropriate for formal documentation that may follow later in the process.

Best regards,
HR Team

---

From: hr.team@company.com
To: candidate@email.com
Subject: RE: Job Application Guidelines - Example of Poor Communication
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 09:45
Body: Here's an example of what to avoid in your communications:

Dear Mr. Goldie,
I would like to inform you that a final decision has been made about the hiring process and I need to come to London to continue the recruitment process on the 12th of November. I will be leaving Paris on the 11th at 1 pm. I will be going by train and I will reach Paris Nord at 6.30. I would be very grateful if you could arrange a car and driver to collect me.

This example is too informal and makes assumptions about travel arrangements. Always maintain professionalism and discuss logistics only after they've been formally offered.

Best regards,
HR Team

This email contains a Java applet for making a short clip of any size from a video file. At the beginning of the clip a button labeled 'Start' appears, and once the user clicks on this button, the clip begins to play. During the clip, the button will change to 'Pause' if the user pauses the clip, and then change back to 'Start' to start the clip again. It is also possible to advance the clip by clicking on the little slider on the right. The clip must be no longer than 10 seconds, but the user can resize the video in any way he likes. The applet works in Chrome, Firefox and Internet Explorer.

Dear Matthieu,

I am also surprised to see the prices being more than USD 30,000 in Europe, when the average price of bitumen in Europe is USD 22,000/MT FOB. Could you please shed some light on the current pricing scenario?
I have been following the Japanese market for quite a while now, I even did a project on the future of petroleum products in Japan (in my Masters thesis), and have been quite impressed by your company. Unfortunately, I
Email 4:

over the last month. The most important thing is that
Japan is a very good market for trading. I’m sure that
the demand from the Japanese market will continue to be
high for bitumen. However, I can understand that
businesses are worried about the recent shortage of fuel
oil which causes the price of products to rise. It looks like
your offer is near the market price, which is usually
good enough for me. As for the freight rate, could you
please check the website at

efault.aspx?menuid=32#cargo/spot.

From: hans.mueller@tradingco.com
To: m.kawashima@kawashima-trading.com
Subject: Bitumen Cargo Inquiry - Jubail to Salalah
Timestamp: 2023-05-20 09:15
Body: Morning Matthieu,

We're looking to charter a 7,100MT cargo of bitumen from Jubail to Salalah for delivery in 2 months time. Could you offer your best freight idea and vessel?

Regards,
Hans

---

From: m.kawashima@kawashima-trading.com
To: hans.mueller@tradingco.com
Subject: Re: Bitumen Cargo Inquiry - Jubail to Salalah
Timestamp: 2023-05-20 11:30
Body: Dear Hans,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can offer the following routes:

1. Sri Lanka-Italy at $40,000/MT
2. Sri Lanka-Istanbul at $39,000/MT
3. Sri Lanka-Dubai at $37,000/MT

We can provide vessels in the following categories:

- Safety Ship Type
- 20 years old Clean built Type

For current rates and additional options, please visit our website.

Best regards,
Matthieu Kawashima
CEO, Kawashima Trading Corporation Inc.

---

From: hans.mueller@tradingco.com
To: m.kawashima@kawashima-trading.com
Subject: Re: Bitumen Cargo Inquiry - Jubail to Salalah
Timestamp: 2023-05-21 08:45
Body: Dear Matthieu,

I've reviewed the prices on your website and notice they're significantly higher than market rates. Current market average is USD 27,000/MT FOB Gulf, while European prices average USD 22,000/MT FOB. Your listed prices seem to be around USD 32,000/MT FOB Gulf.

Could you explain this pricing differential?

Best regards,
Hans

---

From: m.kawashima@kawashima-trading.com
To: hans.mueller@tradingco.com
Subject: Re: Bitumen Cargo Inquiry - Jubail to Salalah
Timestamp: 2023-05-21 14:20
Body: Dear Hans,

Thank you for your message. The current pricing reflects recent market changes, particularly in Europe. The Japanese market remains strong for bitumen trading, though we acknowledge concerns about fuel oil shortages affecting product prices.

Your price reference is close to market rates. For detailed freight information, please check our website's cargo spot section.

Best regards,
Matthieu

---

From: m.kawashima@kawashima-trading.com
To: hans.mueller@tradingco.com
Subject: Re: Bitumen Cargo Inquiry - Jubail to Salalah
Timestamp: 2023-05-22 09:10
Body: Dear Hans,

Regarding vessel availability, we're currently working with schedules for:
- Osaka delivery for July 1st
- Second Osaka delivery for July 4th
- Port Said for August 7th

Please note there are some delays due to congestion in Incheon and Ningbo ports.

Best regards,
Matthieu

input_text:
Email 1:
Hi M. Corbin,                    Do you plan to invest in dry bulk shipping?                    Your inbox is getting full. Can you help us?                    Our selection process has begun, please let us know.                    Thank you for your participation!                    Vladimir
Email 2:
The area is the center of the recently emerged "dry bulk finance bubble" centered in Singapore. It is clear that large volumes of capital are coming from banks and investment firms into the dry bulk shipping market. The real question is whether any of this additional volume of shipping loans will improve returns to the shipping sector and make a difference in financing this sector as a whole. If you would like to know more about the potential pitfalls and opportunities surrounding dry bulk finance, please do not hesitate to get in touch.   
Thanks for reaching out,                     Anatoliy


Author: Vladimir
Email Type: Sales
Domain: Shipping Finance
Opportunity: Focused
Probability: 70%
Email 3:
The dry bulk finance market is booming, with many shipping companies taking advantage of the low interest rate environment and increased demand for commodities. The biggest issue in this market is that the interest rates are so low, that they can actually hurt the shipping companies' profit margins. This is because the low interest rates mean that the companies can borrow money at lower rates, but they are also unable to earn as much in interest. This means that the companies are able to pay off their loans more quickly, but they don't earn as much in profits as they would if they had to pay more interest. The other issue is that the demand for commodities is decreasing, which means that the companies are having to carry more unsold ships, which costs them money. The best way to make a profit in this market is to find a way to cut costs and make your shipping company more efficient.
<Email 4>

Anatoliy

I wanted to elaborate on the current market conditions. While the dry bulk finance market is experiencing growth due to the low interest rate environment, there are important factors to consider:

- Low interest rates are impacting profit margins
- Decreasing commodity demand affects vessel utilization
- Cost efficiency is becoming crucial for profitability

Would you like to schedule a call to discuss these points in more detail?

Best regards,
Vladimir

From: john.smith@company.com
To: vargas@freightline.com
Subject: Re: Shipping Query - Portugal Route
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 14:20
Body: Hello,

I have just contacted you about pallets of clothing going to Portugal. My first concern is about insurance. What's your standard coverage, and would I be able to extend it beyond that if I needed to?

Also, is there a rate I need to know in advance so that I can inform the shippers what they will be paying?

Lastly, how long would it take for the shipment to reach the port of Lisbon?

Thank you!
John

---

From: vargas@freightline.com
To: john.smith@company.com
Subject: Re: Shipping Query - Portugal Route
Timestamp: 2024-01-15 15:45
Body: Hi John,

For Portugal shipments, our standard insurance is $1.50 per kg. We can extend coverage up to $2.50 per kg for $1500 shipping, which covers $3 per pallet.

Regarding pickup location, we can arrange from either Dallas or Houston. Please let us know your preferred location as soon as possible to proceed with arrangements.

Best regards,
Mr. Vargas

---

From: john.smith@company.com
To: vargas@freightline.com
Subject: Shoe Shipment to Lisbon
Timestamp: 2024-01-22 10:15
Body: Hi Mr. Vargas,

I just finished loading my shipment to ship to Portugal this morning, with another 25 40' containers coming next week. Would you be able to give me an accurate estimation of when you can get it out to Lisbon?

I can't wait to get these shoes in there! I want to get them to market ASAP.

Thank you for your help,
John

---

From: john.smith@company.com
To: vargas@freightline.com
Subject: Re: Warehouse Delivery Time
Timestamp: 2024-01-22 16:30
Body: Great! That's perfect. The day after tomorrow works for me, as soon as we get this one out!

What time is the best to arrive at your warehouse, and what time can you get the shipment to the port?

John

However, we can't deliver to Rio de Janeiro before next year, we don't have ships or even any empty containers to send it to you.                    Thanks,                    Seth


Now, your task is to help Seth write an email to reply to Tobias that satisfies their needs and requirements. It should include the items from <Email 1> and <Email 2>. You are able to modify these emails and/or make a new one.

Let's use the following variables, which represent the parts of Seth's email:
{{From}}                → sender's email address (you'll have to send this as the actual sender's email address)

Email 3:

From: seth.parker@tradingco.com
To: tobias.schmidt@freightserv.com
Subject: Furnace Oil Shipment Request - Fujairah to Rio
Timestamp: 2023-08-15 09:30
Body: Hi Tobias,

We require 3,700MT of furnace oil shipment from Fujairah to Rio de Janeiro with delivery needed early in September. Could you please check availability and confirm if you can accommodate our tight timeframe?

Best regards,
Seth

---

From: tobias.schmidt@freightserv.com
To: seth.parker@tradingco.com
Subject: Re: Furnace Oil Shipment Request - Fujairah to Rio
Timestamp: 2023-08-15 11:45
Body: Dear Seth,

Thank you for your inquiry. Unfortunately, we are experiencing severe capacity constraints at the moment. While we could potentially handle around 1,000MT, we have no vessels or containers available for the Fujairah-Rio route until early next year.

Let me know if you'd like to explore alternative options or timeframes.

Best regards,
Tobias

---

From: seth.parker@tradingco.com
To: tobias.schmidt@freightserv.com
Subject: Re: Furnace Oil Shipment Request - Fujairah to Rio
Timestamp: 2023-08-15 14:20
Body: Hi Tobias,

Thank you for your prompt response. I understand the limitations regarding shipping capacity. Given that we have 1,000MT ready for immediate shipment, would it be possible to explore alternative routes or transshipment options that might help us meet our September timeline? If not, we may need to seek other shipping partners for this urgent cargo.

Best regards,
Seth
